characters: ACROSS KIRK AND THE OTHERS TO THE SHOWER STALL
A CORNER OF THE INTERMIX CHAMBER
CAMERA BRIDGING BACK OUT THROUGH SPOCK'S EYES AND INTO
ACROSS THE NAVIGATOR'S STATION TO KIRK AND DECKER
THE LUMINESCENT CLOUD, (AS SEEN ON A VIEWER)
ACROSS DECKER TO THE SMASHED DOOR
251A ACROSS THEM TO THE MAIN VIEWER
INCLUDING THE VIEWER KIRK AND THE OTHERS
PAST THEM TO THE POD WINDOW, (O)
ACROSS SCOTT TO KIRK AND DECKER
FULL SHOT OF THE KLINGON SHIP BEING DESTROY
ACROSS THEM TO ANOTHER SECTION OF THE WALL
PAST KIRK AND SPOCK TO THE VIEWER
WHAT THEY SEE ON MAIN VIEWER, (O)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the far distance, slowly growing in size as CAMERA APPROACHES: it resembles, vaguely at this distance, an Aurora Borealis: flaring colors from the fringes, beautiful yet ominous. It is so large, this Cloud, it can envelope an entire solar system. CAMERA CONTINUES APPROACHING the Cloud, and then suddenly, crossing our POV, a:

dialogues.speaker: KLINGON HEAVY CRUISER, (S)
dialogues.text: In a graceful, turning arc toward the mysterious LUMINESCENCE. CAMERA FOLLOWS this Klingon, then FINDS a second Klingon cruiser, also turning toward the Cloud, which continues to grow in size as the Klingons approach at warp speed, CAMERA CLOSING on the lead ship, until the vessel's detail can be clearly MADE OUT: lights, weaponry, power systems, identification emblazoned on the nacelles and saucer in Klingon language (and symbols).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly alien, an ODD-SOUNDING KLAXON signaling "battle stations." Orders issued in KLINGON LANGUAGE, the KLINGON CAPTAIN and EXEC peering at an unusual bridge viewer at the huge area of LUMINESCENT HAZE directly ahead. In KLINGON DIALOGUE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Give me tactical.)

dialogues.speaker: MAIN VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: goes suddenly  to a TACTICAL GRID SYSTEM, showing the LUMINESCENT HAZE to be an ENORMOUS BLIP OF LIGHT ON THE SCREEN, with two TINY PINPRICKS OF LIGHT complete- ing their turn on a direct course toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patrol is clearly SEEN now on the right of the  bottom of the FRAME... THREE tiny ships closing on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: steadily growing LUMINESCENT HAZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on the viewer that shows the ships sweeping on the Mysterious cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Klingonese) Visual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TECHNICIAN makes the switch.

dialogues.speaker: VIEW SCREEN
dialogues.text: growing ever larger, its flaring colors menacing, mysterious, strangely beckoning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew stands by for battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Klingonese) Tactical again. Stand by on torpedoes.

dialogues.speaker: EAT SPACE
dialogues.text: sliding open, the glowing "Hell Fire" of the Photon Launch tubes, slowly revealed.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE SHIPS, (S)
dialogues.text: They are tiny, insect-like shapes moving still CLOSER to the Luminescent Cloud, so large now that it begins to dominate all space behind.

dialogues.speaker: EXEC, (O)
dialogues.text: The growing nearness and enormous size of the Cloud also reflected on the Tactical Grid, somehow more awesome by this schematic view. The Captain gestures the order to "FIRE."

dialogues.speaker: KLINGON VESSEL
dialogues.text: The BRILLIANT PHOTON BLOBS of the torpedoes spurt from  the tubes.

dialogues.speaker: KLINGON VESSEL, (S)
dialogues.text: A deadly PHOTON TORPEDO pattern racing away from the Klingon and toward the Luminescent glow in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three torpedoes are heading directly toward the Cloud. Suddenly they glow briefly and disappear long before they reach their intended target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: incredulous that their torpedoes have disappeared without a trace.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SPACE
dialogues.text: as the second and third ships launch torpedoes toward the color-flaring surface of the cloud. This time we have an outside, real VIEW of the torpedoes glowing brightly and then disappearing with no effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingon crew grim, desperate, watching a BRIGHT STACCATO BLIP OF POWER from within the LUMINESCENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly; Klingonese) Full force fields; evasive maneuvers.

dialogues.speaker: EAT SPACE
dialogues.text: Out of the LUMINESCENCE hurtles a FRIGHTENING WHIPLASH OF ENERGY. It bears down on the Klingon Patrol, now in an evasive maneuver. Then the WHIPLASH BOLT hits the third cruiser in a writhing flare of energy which totally engulfs the vessel. The other two ships veer off, warping around again into attack position. The THIRD SHIP has begun to implode in on itself, the matter-energy of its existence drained by the WHIPLASH BOLT that HOLDS IT.

dialogues.speaker: REMAINING KLINGON CRUISERS, (S)
dialogues.text: desperately defending themselves, FORCE FIELDS FULL UP, RAPIDLY FIRING PHOTON TORPEDOES. But now a SECOND WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT has emerged from the cloud and hits the second vessel, DESTROYING it. The THIRD WHIPLASH BOLT glances off the surviving Cruiser as the ship retreats in a wide, evasive turn, FIRING from stern tubes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge shattered; Klingon bodies. The mortally- wounded Captain is transmitting urgently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Klingonese) ... severely damaged. Returning fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serenity here. A barren, rocky small plantoid softly lit by the myriad stars. This is a small Starfleet  outpost, antennae sprouting everywhere. Tiny figures (WORKERS) servicing one antenna illustrate the size of the installation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOWING the battle scene, and the VOICE OF THE KLINGON CAPTAIN in his last stand against the Object; his VOICE is weary, almost mechanical. On the adjacent viewer, an English printout of the Klingon's words chatters along the bottom of the picture:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Klingonese) Imperial Klingon Cruiser Amar... severely damaged by unfamiliar weaponry... intruder unidentified..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the viewers are a FEMALE LIEUTENANT and FOUR TECH- NICIANS. COMMANDER BRANCH, a young, alert, enters hur- riedly, scans he console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our sensor drone is intercepting this on Quad L-14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... believe luminescent cloud  to be enormous power field  surrounding alien vessel...  size and description unknown..  our sensor scans unable to  penetrate. Imperial Klingon  Cruiser Amar... continuing  to attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's within Klingon boundaries. Who are they fighting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unknown, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A violent EXPLOSION inside the Klingon bridge -- Klingon Captain's body is thrown violently against the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an exterior visual!

dialogues.speaker: VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: showing EXTERIOR of the Klingon vessel: a final, frightening WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT strikes it -- then the same awesome IMPLOSION INTO FIREBALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Starfleet station onlookers react to the utter annihilation of the huge cruiser. And now, past where the cruiser just disappeared -- the mysterious LUMINES- CENCE approaching in distance. Technician hits a switch, magnifying the strange CLOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've plotted a course on that cloud, Commander: it will pass into Federation Space fairly  close to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading?

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN MONITOR STATION, (O)
dialogues.text: as its focal point shifts to the huge elliptically- shaped LUMINESCENCE racing across the sky. MUSIC (V'GER THEME) COMMENCES in a low, unresolved CHORD that remains in the background through the remainder of this scene, and the beginning of the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, it's on a precise heading for Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ominously now the LUMINESCENCE increases in size, and begins to fill the viewer. HOLD A MOMENT, and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the CAMERA MOVING THROUGH masses of thick, steamy vaporous clouds, swirling about, rising boilingly up from some unseen, underground source. The CAMERA CONTINUES MOVING through clouds. And then... the Vulcan landscape. Harsh, strange angular peaks and rock formations -- the barren, legend- ary mountain home of Vulcan Masters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's lean features instantly recognizable despite unkempt, longer hair and the fatigue born of a long, harsh discipline he has undergone. His robes, tattered and dust covered, are that of a Vulcan Aspirant in study with the Masters. Under the V'ger THEME MUSIC we HEAR a VOICE in ritual tones:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, son of Sarek of Vulcan...  and of Amanda of Earth...  diligently you have labored for  purification of mind...

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK, VULCAN MASTERS AND RUINS
dialogues.text: In b.g., gigantic ancient Vulcan statues and ruins. In f. the stone platform on which Spock stands facing a semi-ci of three similar platforms. On them in regal robes are th VULCAN MASTERS. The Master in the center is a female, the other two Masters are male. The elderly female is holding cord and ancient pendant as if ready to place it around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's neck at an appropriate moment. Spock is staring u as V'ger THEME MUSIC fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chidingly) Spock . . . !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock turns, giving a small contrite nod -- the ritual continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are these sands, our fore- bearers cast out their animal  passions. Here our race was  saved by the first attainment of  Kolinahr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kolinahr: the final shedding of  all emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have labored long, Spock. Now receive from us this symbol of total logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock starts to kneel... the Female Master moves in, intending to put the ancient pendant around his neck.  But Spock now hesitates -- he's troubled as though  uncertain he deserves this symbol and waves the  pendant away. Then, a faint reprise of the V'ger THEME  MUSIC now causes the Female Master to look skyward.  She turns from this back to Spock as she exchanges a  look with the Male Masters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures Spock forward) Come, give me your thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels with Spock -- lays her hands on his temples  in Vulcan mind-meld position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Our minds, Spock... One and together....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes close -- their minds meld -- then her head jerks slightly, her features change as her mind feels Spock's reactions to the V'ger consciousness. A long moment, then she opens her eyes, gets to her feet and looks down on the still kneeling Spock. Then, she casts aside the pendant she carries -- it falls into the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; sadly) This consciousness which calls -- it stirs your human half, Spock? You have not achieved Kolinahr -- Your human emotions are not fully extinguished. (turns to the other Masters) He will not achieve his goal with us. His answer lies elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three Masters leave -- Spock watches them go, his disappointment evident even in his stoic features.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: CAMERA CLOSES IN on his face as we again HEAR a frag- ment of V'ger THEME MUSIC -- Spock again raises his head and peers up into the heavens. HOLD on his face a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gleaming silver in the sun as it streaks TOWARD THE CAMERA POSITION and hurtles PAST.

dialogues.speaker: DAY, (M)
dialogues.text: From this vantage, we can SEE all of twenty-third century San Francisco stretched out before us. In the b.g., the familiar forms of the carefully preserved Golden Gate Bridge and Transamerica Pyramid Building serve as our only reminders that this is, indeed, San Francisco. The AIR TRAM (an anti-gravitational train flying several feet above the ground) DECELERATES sharply, settles to the ground with a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: TRAM DOORS
dialogues.text: The doors opening, and various TRAVELERS (civilians and Starfleet personnel) leaving the tram, striding onto the platform, continuing on their respective ways. Among the departing throng:

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: in Admiral's uniform, grim, determined, moving through the throng. Now and then Starfleet officers nod re- spectfully; KIRK responds with detached formality; his mind is clearly set on something he is resolved to ac- complish here in headquarters -- whatever the cost. CAMERA WITH HIM, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk strides into the graceful Starfleet HQ building. Many PEOPLE are about, civilians and uniformed person- nel; most of them with some air of urgency. (NOTE: ALIENS interspersed among them, Vulcans, blue-skinned Andorians, high-domed Vegans, ect.) Kirk continues on when suddenly he reacts, annoyed as he sees:

dialogues.speaker: SONAK
dialogues.text: a Vulcan, Lt Commander; short, white-haired, grizzled, hurrying along. Kirk calls to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Sonak... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONAK turns with Vulcan imperturbability to face Kirk who steps toward him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You've received your appointment as Enterprise Science Officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Based, I am told, on your recommendation, Admiral. Thank                            you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you on board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Decker requested I complete final Science briefing here before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Here at Starfleet...? The Enterprise is in final preparation to leave dock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which will require twenty more hours at minimum, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve! I'm on my way to a meeting with Admiral Nogura which will not  last more than three minutes. Report to me on the Enterprise in one hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I intend to be there following  that meeting. Report to me. One  hour!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk turns, strides purposefully away. Sonak gazes after him, one eyebrow raised quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In f.g., Orbital drydock offices, rotating slowly but perceptibly against blue-black of space. Small figures in spacesuits working on construction, with work belts. Beyond and below... Earth. In the far distance we can barely make out an orbital drydock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cluster is a fully-equipped dockyard engineering center and computer drafting office. CAMERA MOVES IN AND CENTERS ON an outer "Travel Pod."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: an installation which also includes a double position transporter, in which we SEE the TRANSPORTER EFFECT BEGIN. With the TRANSPORTER CREW IS SCOTT. He's with a Technician, busy with a piece of complex circuitry. Then he turns, sees that it is Kirk BEAMING in here. As Kirk materializes, steps off the transporter plat- form, Scott moves quickly to him.

dialogues.speaker: 40A KIRK AND SCOTT
dialogues.text: The starship Engineering Officer clearly surprised to see Kirk here. Kirk has the same look of grim de- termination we just saw in the headquarters building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, I've been hoping to see you. Maybe you can get through  to those thick heads in Starfleet that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't the Enterprise transporters in operation, Mister Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hoping it's only a temporary problem, Admiral...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that it is. (moving toward pod) Take me over, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is now eying Kirk just a little warily as he fol- lows him into the pod. Kirk's determined expression suggests that some chips are going to fly and Scott does not want to become one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Admiral, the Enterprise has just finished eighteen months redesign- ing and refitting. She needs  testing, a shakedown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, there's an alien object with unbelievable destructive  power less than three days away  from this planet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk hits a button on the travel pod panel -- the air- lock doors SLAM closed behind them. Then, stepping im- mediately to the front observation window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... the only Starship in interception range is the Enterprise! Ready, or not, she launches in twelve hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott throws Kirk an appalled look but is now occupied in sealing the Outer Pod door and manipulating drive controls. CAMERA CONTINUES TO PULL BACK TO REVEAL front of the Pod and arms of the office complex as Pod disconnects and starts to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES TO PULL BACK TO REVEAL front of the pod and arms of the office complex as Pod disconnects and starts moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it moves way from the office complex. We can SEE the jet flames of its tiny thrusters as it cir- cles around, heads off (toward the distant Orbital dry dock).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott nervously eying Kirk, and finally deciding to make one more effort:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew hasn't had near enough transition time with all the new equipment. And the engines, Admiral: they've yet to be even tested at warp power. Add to  that, an untried Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hint of smile) Two and a half years as Chief of Starfleet Operations may have made me a little stale, Mr. Scott -- but I wouldn't exactly consider myself 'untried.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes Scott a moment to comprehend, and Kirk smiles now, nods:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) They gave her back to me, Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott peers at him, genuinely surprised -- and pleased. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Gave' her back, sir...? I doubt it was that easy... (returns smile) But any man who could manage such a feat, I wouldna dare disappoint. She'll launch on time, sir... (with confidence) And she'll be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he clasps Kirk's elbow affectionately, then gestures Kirk to look out the pod window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he looks out: the blue-black of orbital space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is well aware of what the Enterprise means to Kirk. As Scott maneuvers the pod to provide the best perspective, Kirk peers through the observation window, craning his head, hungry for his first glimpse of the starship. Scott is watching him, immensely pleased.

dialogues.speaker: PAST THEM TO THE POD WINDOW, (O)
dialogues.text: as we SEE the drydock and more of its detail, and a hint of what is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAST Kirk and Scott the corner of the drydock becomes larger -- we begin SEEING more of it. And then the merest glimpse of what is inside the drydock: The Enterprise slips INTO VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AT WINDOW
dialogues.text: as he watches, his face reflecting all of it: the awe, the wonder, the romance, the obsession. The one comp- lete love of his life. And with that love regained, he is becoming more fully alive again. Kirk looks at Scott; for a moment both hold each other's eye. Scott knows precisely how Kirk feels. Both turn to the window again.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: Now DOMINATING the SCREEN -- the awesome, symmetrical bulk of the starship comes fully INTO VIEW. And it dominates Kirk's -- and our emotions.

dialogues.speaker: AS IT CIRCLES
dialogues.text: The great ship dwarfs everything. The drydock becomes a fragile filigree framing the ship's great curved bulk. The tiny pod continues to move along it. Small automated welding devices move along the gird- ers, working with brief, bright orange-white flares. In other areas of metal lace structure, supplies and equipment are being loaded onto the ship. The pod continues moving (Scott is giving Kirk time to see all), watched carefully by the TINY FIGURES OF SUPERVISING TECHNICIANS on the drydock. Now the pod moves toward mating position. It closes in, secures itself to the outer airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott completing the mating procedure, Kirk turning from the observation window. Outside, the metallic.. CLICK of the pod locking onto the airlock. Now the "WHOOSH" of the latch doors securing, the CLANG of security bolts. It's all been a rare and delicious moment for Kirk, and his face shows it. OVER the POD INTERCOM we HEAR, "Pod secured. Pressure equalized." Scott moves the control to open the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confusion of organized work and VOICES. The cargo deck bustles with activity; supplies and equipment being stored and installed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Scott are met by a nervous, perspiring ENSIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to come aboard, sir...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granted, sir. Welcome aboard, Admiral... Commander Scott, you're needed in Engineering immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) Sir, you'll excuse me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gestures him to leave, and Scott hurries away. Kirk stands a moment, gazing down at the cargo deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew maneuvering antigravity devices which move heavy containers -- scrambles of activity at storage holds and maintenance lockers.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND ENSIGN
dialogues.text: Kirk is drinking it all in. He's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Sir, if you'll follow me, I'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can find my way, Ensign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk moves off, leaving the Ensign gazing at him, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk ENTERS ANGLE and the doors snap open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk enters. The doors close. Kirk waits a beat, savoring this moment too. Then, firmly to the control panel:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turbo-elevator HUMS WITH POWER as it begins hur- tling up. On the wall back of Kirk we SEE an electronic diagram of the Enterprise tracking the elevator's  speedy trip to the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confusion of activity and VOICES. Pieces o equip- ment in a state of disarray: consoles open, fiber optic tubes unconnected, viewing screens dismantled. It's a frantic, desperate scene -- a ship and crew to- tally unprepared. In the midst of this: ALIEN ensign is assisting UHURA (Lt. Comdr. stripes)deftly working her communications station, AD LIBBING "... Hailing frequency four, check. Hailing frequency five, will someone please check me?" At the helm, sweat-soaked SULU (Lt. Comdr stripes) has a service plate open, is peering inside to make delicate adjust- ments, AD LIBBING "... Helm, now give me a reading on four point zero zero six of full." And at the Weapons Control, CHEKOV (Full Lt.)argues with TECHNICIANS who insist photon torpedoes read "ready" while Chekov argues the computer is not relaying that information.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR DOORS
dialogues.text: snapping open -- and there is Kirk. For the moment no one notices him, and he stands watching, remembering. And then he moves forward toward the command center.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS UHURA TO KIRK
dialogues.text: as she is the first to see him. She reacts,pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... Starfleet just  signaled your transfer-of- command orders!

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS REACTION
dialogues.text: as everyone else is suddenly aware of Kirk. All work stops, with various AD LIBBED greetings from the old crew: "Admiral Kirk..." "It's the Captain...!" etc., etc. But most sit or stand, simple gaping at Kirk, all quite awed. The old hands, Uhura, Sulu, and Chekov start converging on Kirk. But he gestures them back, speaking crisply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate the welcome; I wish the circumstances were less critical. (to Uhura) Epsilon Nine is monitoring the intruder; keep a channel open to them. (glances around) Where is Captain Decker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Engineering, sir... (uncomfortable, indicates Captain's  chair) He doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk reacts with some exasperation, starts away, addresses Chekov:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Chekov, assemble the crew on the Rec Deck at 0400 hours. I want to show them what we're  facing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk moves to the elevator, enters, is gone. The moment the elevator doors snap closed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have wanted to have been standing in his way. He wanted her back; he got her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perturbed) And Captain Decker? He's been with the ship every minute of her refitting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brittle) Ensign -- our chances of coming back from this mission in one piece may have just doubled...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire complex a beehive of pre-departure activity. ENGINEERING PERSONNEL (at least a third of them female) coming and going, the platform-elevators (small, one- man lifts to various levels) busy. A gentle but con- stant HUM and WHIRR flows from the engine core, to indi- cate a pre-idling mode. There will be continual AD LIBBED conversation among the Technicians. Now the Engine Room door opens and Kirk steps into the  area. He stands a moment observing the activity. a grizzled ENGINEERING CHIEF pushes a huge condenser on an anti-grav device past irk with a respectful "watch it, sir" admonishment. Kirk moves on to:

dialogues.speaker: THE INTERMIX CHAMBER
dialogues.text: at the middle of the power shaft. Very NOISY here, and a continual CACOPHONY of COMPUTERIZED AND HUMAN VOICES calling off equipment checks. And grouped  around a section of burnt-out circuitry are WILLARD DECKER, Captain's stripes, handsome, in his early 30's; Scott, and two Technicians. Decker and Scott are working feverishly uncoupling the device,  probing its innards. Decker has discovered the problem, removed several transistor-type parts, taps them  with a pencil-sized sonic analyzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly elated) I thought so! See... the trans- porter sensor was not activated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Aye, you were dead right about that... (to Technician) Clearly, put a back-up sensor into the unit.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THEM TO KIRK
dialogues.text: as the Technician prepares to install the device, Scott glances up to see Kirk. He looks from Decker to Kirk in acute embarrassment (so that we should realize Scott hasn't mentioned Kirk's taking over to Decker). Decker now notices Kirk, reacts pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Kirk... (shakes Kirk's hand) We're getting a top brass send off...? (self assured grin) She'll launch on schedule if we have to tow her out with our bare hands. Right, Scotty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lamely) Aye, sir, that we will...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Decker) Will, let's go over here and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates corner. Decker glances bemusedly at Kirk, then turns to Scott:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me now when the back-up is  in place.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS SCOTT TO KIRK AND DECKER
dialogues.text: as Scott AD LIBS a glum "Aye, sir," and watches them walk across the Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: A CORNER OF THE INTERMIX CHAMBER
dialogues.text: just a little quieter here, with Kirk and Decker arriv- ing, and Decker saying blithely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All due respect, sir, I hope this isn't a Starfleet pep talk; I'm just too busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk eyes Decker -- then decides the best way to say it is plainly, directly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking over the Center seat.  I'm sorry, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm replacing you as Captain of the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker seems shocked into silence; he can only peer at Kirk who reaches tentatively as though to clasp a paternal hand on Decker's shoulder, then withdraws it and continues quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You'll stay aboard as Executive Officer... a temporary grade reduction to Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding his voice) -- You, personally, are assuming command?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) My experience -- five years out there dealing with unknowns like this -- my familiarity with the Enterprise, this crew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral, this is an almost totally new enterprise. You don't know her a tenth as well as I do.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: Scott, working on the relay, but continually glancing at Kirk and Decker with worried concern, as Kirk replies:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you're staying aboard. I'm sorry, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Admiral. I don't think you are; not one damned bit. I remember when you recommended me for this command. You told me how envious you were, and if only you could find a way to get a starship command again. Well, sir, it looks like you found a way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is silent a moment, peering levelly at Decker, who returns the gaze with equal intensity. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report to the bridge, Commander. Immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker EXITS. Kirk waits, collecting his composure as he watches him go. Then Kirk turns to glare at Scott. Interrupted by a flare as something shorts out at the mechanism where Scott and Decker had been working. Technician (Clearly) reacts, hits an inter- com button fast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter room, come in! Urgent! (to Scott) Redline on the transporters, Mister Scott!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott whirls to a console fast, speaks urgently!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporter room, do not engage! Do not....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting to the reading; interruption) Too late; they're beaming now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is exiting on a run, followed by Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unusually defective looking TRANSPORTER EFFECT in progress, alternately flashing and glowing -- even the Transporter SOUND seems wrong, as if struggling to overcome some problem. At the console, CHIEF RAND and ASSISTANT are reacting in surprised, near-horror as they attempt vainly to save the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Starfleet, override us! OVERRIDE...! Yank them back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, from Rand's console,a VIOLENT GLARE -- a PROTESTING SOUND from the circuitry. And on the con- sole a red-warning light now begins flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to retrieve their pattern, Enterprise....!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rand reacts in real horror now as human forms begin to FAINTLY MATERIALIZE, then FADE AWAY, then REAPPEAR IN FAINTLY MISSHAPEN FORM as she frantically works con- trols. Kirk ENTERS fast, steps to the console to assist Rand; Scott has also come in and moves to the console, brushes aside the Asst. Chief, and begins manipulating the additional controls himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing the pattern...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Starfleet, boost your matter gain;  we need more signal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! They're forming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the human forms FLUTTERING INTO FULLER AND FULLER MATERIALIZATION, FRIGHTENINGLY, HORRIBLY MISSHAPEN. We RECOGNIZE one form as the Vulcan, Sonak -- the other a human WOMAN. They MATERIALIZE; we HEAR A MOAN form  from the Vulcan -- the Woman's SCREAM OF PAIN. Then, all at once, the half-materialized bodies are gone; the transporter chamber is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...!

dialogues.speaker: KIRK, SCOTT AND RAND
dialogues.text: gazing, horrified, at the empty chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Starfleet, do you have them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mutter of utter, vacant silence -- and Kirk and Scott look at each other again, their pained faces presaging the answer they already know:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) Enterprise... what we got back didn't live long. Fortunately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moment of stunned silence, and then Kirk hits the transmission button -- fighting to control his voice as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet... Kirk. Please... express my condolences to their families. Commander Sonak's can be reached through the Vulcan Embassy. (see Rand's stricken expression) There was nothing you could have done, Rand. It wasn't your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And before Rand can answer, Kirk leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk steps out, and the doors snap closed behind him. In the corridor the furor of the hurried depar- ture is, as everywhere, quite evident: CREW MEMBERS move back and forth. But Kirk does not see them; his mind is tormented by the transporter accident -- was there something he should have done, could have done, to prevent it? Should he launch on schedule with the starship this unready? Has he done right in yielding to this terrible needs for starship command again, forcing Starfleet to give her to him? Would Decker's knowledge of the new design have prevented the acci- dent? Kirk reaches a corridor intersection, looks around, realizes he's lost track of where he is. A passing YEOMAN stops in response to his puzzled expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turboshaft eight...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back that way, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's indicating back the direction from which Kirk came. He nods his thanks, turns and moves back down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER
dialogues.text: hurrying down the corridor. The two face each other a silent moment, Decker studying Kirk curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to replace Commander Sonak. I'd still like a Vulcan there, if possible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None available, Captain. There's no one in fact, who's fully rated on this design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are, Mister Decker. I'm afraid you'll have to double as Science Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk moves on, Decker stands gazing reflectively after him.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SHOT OF THE KLINGON SHIP BEING DESTROY
dialogues.text: (AS SEEN ON VIEWER) (O)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the last part of the scene which showed the Klingon Captain speaking in Klingonese and an English print- out interpretation appearing at the screen bottom. The Klingon ship nearly totaled; one engine nacelle gone, smoke and flame spewing from the other, etc. And then that final WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT STRIKING AND SPECTACULARLY DESTROYING THE SHIP, etc.) But this time, O.S., we HEAR GASPS of incredulity from many throats (an audience), and various AD LIBBED com- ments: "My God...!" "I don't believe it...!" "What could it be...?" Etc., etc. And then, immediately following this, on the viewer:

dialogues.speaker: THE LUMINESCENT CLOUD, (AS SEEN ON A VIEWER)
dialogues.text: (as in earlier Epsilon 9 viewer -- but with no music, only more AD LIBBED exclamations from an audience.) The viewer goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE that all this was being viewed by the CREW MEMBERS (Aliens included) assembled on the Rec Deck. The Recreation Deck is one of the largest areas on the ship, several deck levels high, a part of one wall consisting of picture windows, through which can be seen sections of the drydock structure outside. On another wall is a large viewer, on which was just shown the Klingon transmission. Leading off and away from this deck area are what are obviously other specific recreation areas -- gymnasiums, food centers, game rooms, lounges, etc.

dialogues.speaker: THE RED DECK
dialogues.text: as the Crew Members chat in low, grim tones -- Kirk (now with Captain's stripes) appears. As he comes into view, the two hundred or so crew below go silent. Kirk grimly indicates the now blank viewer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all we know about it; except that it's now 2.2 days from Earth. Enterprise is the only Federation starship that stands in its way.

dialogues.speaker: CREW REACTIONS
dialogues.text: as the CAMERA FINDS various faces: human, alien; most young, all intelligent, forthright -- anxious. Kirk has paused a moment, now continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We assume there is a vessel of some type at the heart of the cloud. Our orders are to intercept, investigate; and take whatever action is necessary... and possible. (beat) ...We can only hope that the life form aboard that vessel reasons as we do.

dialogues.speaker: UHURA
dialogues.text: standing near an intercom, which just then has emitted a bosun's WHISTLE intercom signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from intercom) Bridge to Captain. Priority signal from Epsilon Nine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk leans over to the intercom, speaks into it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on the viewer here...!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE REC DECK VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: as all eyes turn to the viewer which fades into a view of Commander Branch, in the Epsilon 9 monitor room. Branch is tense, reflecting extreme urgency. Near Branch, working intently at the console are the Female Lieutenant and a Technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the viewer; checking console readings) Enterprise... the Cloud is definitely a powerfield of some kind... Measures... My God! Over 82 A.U.'s in diameter... Must be something incredible inside there generating it. (looks up from console) We're transmitting linguacode friendship messages on all frequencies. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a null reading at the  center of the 'cloud,' sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely something inside.. there but all scans are being reflected back. (studies readings) Receiving an odd pattern now.. (toward Branch) They seem to be reacting to our scans, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inspecting another console) Some kind of energy surge... (looking up) Enterprise... they could be mistaking our scans as a hostile act... (reacts at readings) Deflectors, emergency full!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branch hits an alarm button; we HEAR ALARM KLAXON SOUNDING. The viewer IMAGE DISTORTS, clears again while Branch -- facing his viewer, continues urgently:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We are under attack...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Uhura) External view...!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VIEWER
dialogues.text: as the image of Branch is immediately replaced by an external view of the plantoid, and the LUMINESCENT CLOUD (at about the same distance from which the Klingon cruisers were attacked). Then it STRIKES the plantoid WITH FULL, CATACLYSMIC FORCE. The viewer IMAGE BREAKS UP -- and immediately the entire Starfleet base becomes a maelstrom of FLAR- ING ENERGY, shattered structure, flying debris. And then, all at once, there is nothing -- empty space, Epsilon 9 is gone. We SEE only the stars; and the mysterious LUMINESCENT CLOUD moving across the distant sky. (NOTE: The above is entirely SILENT, and when it is finished, not a word is spoken.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer off.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: as the viewer goes blank, all still facing the screen. Then Kirk turns to the room as if to comment. Then he stops -- nothing he can say will add at all to what they've just seen. Instead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pre-launch countdown will commence in forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CREW
dialogues.text: The scene they have just witnessed still vivid in their minds as they gaze somberly up toward Kirk who is exit- ing. The bridge crew follows him out. Not a word is  said as the remainder of the crew waits another moment, then begins to disperse toward their duty stations too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spectacular ORBIT VIEW of the giant starship in the process of release. BEYOND US, in half light, EARTH LOOMS HUGE. The dock welders are gone; the supply pods float away from the ship. Little tongues of blue flame spurt from the ship's maneuvering jets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the large dock umbilical is released, floats free of its starship attachment. Dock departure is imminent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk in the center seat, intently studying the Naviga- tion console in front of him (at the Navigator's station, which is unoccupied.) Other bridge personnel are busy with their pre-launch duties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transporters Room and Chief Engineer Scott report trans- porter system fully repaired  and now functioning normally,  sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dock signals clear, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rely we are holding position awaiting final crew replacements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Transporter Personnel reports the Navigator... (consults console) ... Lieutenant Junior Grade Ilia (Eye-lee-ah) is already aboard, and en route to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER
dialogues.text: as Decker (now wearing Commander stripes) reacts, almost startled, and Uhura continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Deltan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura's tone and expression convey "Deltan" in a certain, special manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reprovingly) And there are no finer navigators in Starfleet, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last is interrupted by:

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR DOORS
dialogues.text: as they snap open, and there emerges a breathtakingly beautiful young woman (uniformed as a Navigator Lieu- tenant) who strides purposefully onto the bridge. A stunning figure, but hairless, entirely bald but or delicate eyebrows and eyelashes. Her bald head is not  at all unattractive, in fact exudes an aura of sensual nudity. Indeed, her whole being exudes sensuality. (This is a racial characteristic, not a deliberate presence.) She approaches Kirk (NOTE: Throughout this sequence, Sulu eyes ILIA with unrestrained admiration.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Ilia reporting for duty, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (formally; rising) Welcome aboard, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS ILIA TO DECKER
dialogues.text: as Ilia starts to speak, suddenly stops: she has just then noticed Decker, who has stepped from his station to face her. For an electronic moment their eyes meet, hold in unquestioned recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Decker....!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk has observed this with surprise and some concern (it presages possible complications). Decker turns to Kirk, slightly uncomfortable at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was stationed on the Lieutenant's home planet some years ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilia looks from Kirk back to Decker, puzzled at his sleeve stripes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes his rank stripes) 'Commander' Decker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Exec and Science Officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitingly) Captain Kirk has the utmost confidence in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk flashes a hard glance at Decker, then toward Ilia too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) And in you, too, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My oath of celibacy is on record Captain. May I assume my duties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While respectful, her tone of voice has been just as firm as Kirk's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By all means.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK TO UHURA
dialogues.text: receiving a message, now relaying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Starfleet reports our last six crew members ready to beam up... (puzzled) ... but one of them is refusing to step into the transporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Kirk a moment before was tense, now suddenly he's relaxed again; he rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased) Oh? I'll see that he beams up...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hurries from the bridge, onto the elevator, is gone. A moment of puzzled silence, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, take Lieutenant Ilia in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Sir...? (then understands) Yes, of course... (to Ilia) Your pre-programming is already set in, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu has almost tripped getting out of his chair. He starts offering Ilia his hand, then thinks better of it, withdraws it abruptly, immediately busies himself punching out equations on her console... AD LIBS, "It's all on the computer. You'll have no problem..." Sulu is nervous, fluttery around this lovely creature -- now hits a wrong switch. Produces a BEEPING SOUND which he fumbles to shut off. She smiles; speaks quietly, repeats:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sworn to celibacy, Mister Sulu. That makes me as safe as any human female.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu catches her eye but before he can reply, Decker has moved in beside Ilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now the Captain meant no person- al insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on console) I would never take advantage of a sexually immature species. (looks at him) You can assure him that's true, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, the remark carries special, personal significance.

102 Kirk entering as Rand and her assistant electronically list the last of the five arrivals who are leaving the Transporter Chamber. Kirk calls through intercom to the last arrival, a young female Yeoman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeoman, what was the problem down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through intercom) He insisted we go first, sir. Said something about first seeing how it scrambled our molecules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Yeoman (hits transmit control) Starfleet , this is Captain Kirk. The officer is to be beamed up immediately!

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAMBER, (O)
dialogues.text: A moment, then again the GENERATING HUMMING, and then the familiar BEAMING EFFECT. And then you SEE McCOY! He fully MATERIALIZES. He looks himself over as if in pleased surprise he is still in one piece. CAMERA PANS McCoy from the Transporter Chamber to Kirk who is hav- ing a hard time containing his amusement and delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for a man who swore he'd never return to Starfleet... McCOY (flat, tight) What happened, Captain, sir, was that your revered Admiral Nogura invoked a little known -- and seldom used -- reserve activation clause... (snaps) ... in simpler language, Captain, sir, they drafted me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straight-faced) They didn't...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk has offered his hand, but McCoy is already flaring: McCOY This was your idea! It was your idea, wasn't it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, there's a 'thing' out there -- McCOY -- Why is any object we don't understand called a 'thing'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) -- headed this way. I need you...  McCOY Were you behind this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Bones, I need you badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk extends his hand again; McCoy delays some moments -- then finally responds. And once done, it is the long hand clasp of two old friends reunited despite their differences. Now McCoy turns to Rand. McCOY Permission to come aboard, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (elated) Permission granted, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And McCoy moves toward the door, grumbling: McCOY I hear Chapel's an MD now; I need a top nurse, not a doctor who'll argue every diagnosis... And --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even when he's in the corridor his grumbling trails after him. McCOY (continuing) ... they've probably redesigned sickbay, too. Engineers love to change things.

dialogues.speaker: FULL ON KIRK
dialogues.text: as he gazes fondly after the grumbling McCoy, and now turns to the intercom, flips it on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All decks, this is the Captain. Prepare or immediate departure.

108 Bulkheads closing, feed lines disengaging, main ENGINES HUM into life, crew personnel hurrying to launch stations. SHOTS of cargo deck, down to Engineering Section slamming shut. Drydock area clearing, work lights go out, warning lights go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All flight positions manned, ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dock control reports ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helm ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orbital departure on plot, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yard command signaling clear, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maneuvering thrusters, Mister Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maneuvering thrusters, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (working controls) Thrusters at station-keeping, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The starship within the drydock, but now the maneuver- ing -- thrusters spurt pinpoints of BLUE-LAME. The drydock is ready for the starship's departure -- not a single pod or shuttlecraft in sight. The starship looms majestically within the lacework girders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk hesitates just an instant, seems to hold his breath. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thrusters ahead, Mister Sulu.  Take us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maneuvering -- thrusters spurt more BLUE FLAME. The Enterprise begins moving, DOMINATING SCREEN as it moves majestically from the drydock. THEME MUSIC IN AND UP.

117 emphasizing fine detail reality of both drydock and starship as saucer section emerges. Tiny space- suited human figures watch the departing ship. CAMERA HOLDS ON STARSHIP until completely clear of the orbital dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here in Engineering Section, the ENGINE THROBBING SLOWLY BUILDS to a THUNDERING SOUND. A glow from the central unit indicates anti-matter intermix underway. The Engineering Section shudders as the great engines draw more and more power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intermix set, Bridge, impulse power at your discretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he hesitates just an instant. This is the moment he's awaited, and to him it is equally as sensuous and gratifying as making love -- which, perhaps, he is -- to his mistress: The Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Impulse power, Mr Sulu. Ahead Warp point-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maneuvering jets turn off, the impulse drive glows. The Enterprise begins moving perceptibly faster -- behind her, the drydock diminishing rapidly in size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Departure angle on viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Departure angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE viewer IMAGE SWITCH to a departing view of lovely bluish, cloud-laced image of Earth as it grows smaller, smaller, dwindling quickly as the starship gathers speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And viewer IMAGE SWITCHED to show the star patterned space ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with its colorful rings and multiple moons FILLING a  major portion of the FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's Log, stardate 7412.6. 2.7 hours from launch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands tense with the excitement of the journey, on the viewer Saturn -- and its rings -- are falling away (BEHIND US). OVER this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) ... in order to intercept the Intruder at the earliest possible time, we must now risk engaging Warp drive while still within the solar system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of log.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER
dialogues.text: punching in equations on his console, reaching a reading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, assuming we have full Warp capability, accelerating to Warp Seven on leaving solar system will bring us to IP with the Intruder in twenty point one hours.

dialogues.speaker: 122A INCLUDE ILIA
dialogues.text: Checking her console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Science Officer's computations confirmed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Decker and Ilia glance at each other -- and again, you know there is something more than casual in this.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR DOORS
dialogues.text: as they open, and McCoy appears, walks over to Kirk who swings his chair around to face him. McCoy is his usual dour self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Bones, do the new medical facilities meet with your approval? McCOY They do not. It's like working in a damned computer center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Decker) Programming ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Program set for standard Warp entry, Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk starts to swing his chair to normal position -- Decker calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... but I still recommend further simulation study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Decker; every minute brings that object nearer Earth! (using intercom) Engineering! Stand by for Warp Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy is watching Kirk, a bit surprised at his abrupt- ness to Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Captain, we need further Warp simulation on the flow sensors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engineer, we need Warp speed now! McCOY (very gently) You're pushing Jim. Your people know their jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk flashes McCoy a glance of annoyance -- then back to using intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main intermix chambers GLOWING with power; the LOW RUMBLE of the main engines coming to life. The CAMERA FINDS Scott in the chamber:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Hold one minute, please, Captain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps to his console where an ASST. ENGINEER is working a computer, studying the readouts, punching buttons, etc. Scott stands over him, grimly observ- ing. Finally, the Asst. simply shrugs with frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, sir; I can't do any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) Aye, lad... (into intercom) It's borderline on the simulator, Captain: I canna guarantee that she'll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk, annoyed, interrupts Scott on the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp Drive, Mr Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy still watches curiously as Kirk turns to the helm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ahead Warp One, Mr Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accelerating to Warp One, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu moves his controls forward -- everyone waits tensely -- and then we HEAR THE INCREASING THROB OF THE ACCELERATING ENGINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Warp point seven... point eight ... nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE the WARP POWER EFFECT build up between the en- gine "nacelles" -- then the starship makes the QUANTUM LEAP into warp drive. The stars ahead shift, streak, colors pulsating and changing as the shift exceeds the wave lengths of the light spectrum -- and the stars congeal into a MASS ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the viewer shows the same WARP DRIVE EFFECT. or another moment all remain tense, and then all at once relax, release their breaths. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp One, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk smiles, pleased, starts swinging his chair around, at the same time calling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Decker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk never finishes the word. At that instant, on the viewer, a WORMHOLE DISTORTION: a sudden SPIRALING OF STARS AND FLUID LIGHT narrowing into a VORTEX into which the Enterprise hurtles. A space trap, a deadly pandemonium of ALARM KLAXONS, BELLS, VOICES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wormhole!... Get us back on impulse power! Full reverse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise has been caught in a matter-time distortion, sucked into a cylindrical "hole in space" (the Worm- hole distortion), stars and planets become strange, elongated shapes, with the Enterprise drawn deeper and deeper into the vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The KLAXONS and BELLS CONTINUE, and the crew responding:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative helm control, Captain! Going reverse on impulse power...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subspace frequencies are jammed by Wormhole effect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terse, flat) Collision alert...! Collision alert...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Note: Computer alert continues through entire scene.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (consulting his viewer) Negative control from inertial lag will continue 22 point five seconds before forward velocity slows to sub-light speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unidentified small object has been pulled into the wormhole with us, Captain! Directly  ahead...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forcefields up full! Put object  on viewer...!

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: showing (a magnification view) of a tiny point of light directly ahead. Meanwhile, Kirk shouts an AD LIBBED order to Sulu: "Go to Manual override!" Sulu AD LIBS, "No manual response...!" (Through all this, McCoy stands frozen, waiting -- and expecting -- the worse.) Meanwhile, Ilia has reached over to Sulu's console, hits a button, AD LIBBING, "Navigational deflectors coming up...!" And then with alarmed dismay:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navigational deflectors  inoperative...! (consulting her  console, alarmed) Directional control also  inoperative, Captain...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wormhole distortion has over- loaded main power systems...!

dialogues.speaker: MAIN VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: The picture is switched through two further levels of magnification, enlarging the object: an elongated, distorted, pitted asteroid, tumbling toward the Enter- prise on a collision course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toward Ilia) Time to impact...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve seconds...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, stand by on the phasers...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (racing to Chekov's station) Delay that phaser order! Arm photon torpedoes...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133   ANOTHER ANGLE - McCOY NOTICING KIRK who has just glanced, surprised at Decker (for counter- manding the phaser order) -- and for a split instant, Kirk seems confused. McCoy reacts with enlightenment as, meanwhile:

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: The object even larger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photon torpedoes armed...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Object is an asteroid, reading mass point seven... (consulting instruments) Impact in eight seconds... seven... six... five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire torpedoes...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (punching button) Torpedoes away...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the starship's photon torpedo tubes EJECT GLOWING BALLS OF LIGHT ENERGY, which seems to float toward the oncoming asteroid, almost too slowly. And in these brief seconds, the asteroid hurtles at the Enterprise, the huge pitted rock growing even larger than the ship itself. It FILLS THE SCREEN, as the photon torpedoes hit, disintegrating the asteroid into thousands of fragments. Instantly, these fragments pulverize them- selves on the ship's forward forcefield and deflector screens. The smaller pieces burn up on impact, clearly outlining the ship's forcefield barriers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The asteroid fragments still smashing into the force field screen; the smaller bits like SPARKLERS as im- pact heat consumes them. The larger sections bouncing  away, the bridge QUIVERING as they hit. Then one final gigantic fragment strikes, the bridge SHUDDERS. And then the viewer shows only the normal SUB-WARP EFFECT: The stars ahead, relatively station- ary; a feeling of motion, but smooth, visually normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) We're out of it...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are at warp point eight. Position report, Navigator..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helm control restored, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computing new interception course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications are normal, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) Negative damage report, sir. (to McCoy) No casualties reported, sir. McCOY (tight) Wrong, Mr. Chekov, there are casualties. My wits! (to Kirk, indignant) As in 'frightened-out-of'...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Engineer... report status there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Scott and his crew pouring over the instruments -- all seem very grim. Scott, quite preoccupied, now speaks into the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In just a second, Exec; we're  picking up the pieces down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk seeming to collect his thoughts now -- he gives Decker a look, uses the intercom himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp Drive as soon as possible,  Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (protesting) Captain, it was our anti-matter imbalance that created the  wormhole in the first place. It  will happen again if we don't  correct it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That object out there is less than two days from Earth, Mister  Scott. We've got to intercept  while it still is out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near annoyed) Aye, we understand that sir! We're doing our best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk flips off the intercom, rises determinedly, faces Decker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Decker, I'd like to see you in my quarters. (toward helm) You have the conn, Mr. Sulu. McCOY (to Kirk) Mind if I tag along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gives McCoy an annoyed look, then strides to the elevator. Decker, grim, follows -- McCoy brings up the rear as they EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gazing worriedly at the just-closed elevator doors, as Sulu is punching figures into his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintaining warp point  eight; I show our new heading  as 287 point three Mark 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilia's attention is directed toward Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; gently reminding) Lieutenant Ilia...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; then  quickly) Confirmed, Mr. Sulu. Confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she punches in some equations, then again peers up at the doors where she last saw Decker. She is very concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors opening, Kirk entering, McCoy moves to b.g. while Decker stands attentively, waiting as Kirk turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explanation, Mr. Decker: Why was my phaser order countermanded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool, polite) Sir, the Enterprise redesign increases phaser power by channeling it through the main engines. When they went into anti-matter imbalance, the phasers were automatically cut off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is surprised by this information, perhaps slight- ly chagrined. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you acted properly, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. I'm sorry I embar- rassed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly) I'm aware of that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring) Stop competing with me, Decker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to speak freely, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight) Granted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you haven't logged a single star hour in two and a half years. That, plus your unfamiliarity with the ship's design -- in my opinion, sir, seriously jeopardizes  our mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk reacts with anger. Struggles for and regains control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you will... nursemaid me through these difficulties, Mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk peers at Decker, who stands facing him  determinedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I won't keep you from your duties any longer, Commander. (whirling at McCoy) Yes, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's last line has drowned out Decker's "Aye, sir." McCoy says nothing, waits until Decker is gone and the door closes behind him. Then: McCOY He may not be wrong, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker moving toward an elevator -- the elevator doors open, and there is Ilia. She steps out, faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was he difficult?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more than I expected (hesitates) Not as difficult as this. I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you left? or that you didn't say 'goodbye'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd seen you again, would you have been able to say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long hesitation; then shakes head) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilia whirls, moves toward her stateroom door, which snaps open, then closes behind her. Decker stands gazing at the door, remembering, regretful.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 144A   INT. KIRK'S CABIN - KIRK AND McCOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, Bones. McCOY (shakes head) As ship's doctor, I am now discussing the subject of command fitness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's expression hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make your point, Doctor. McCOY The point, Captain, is that it's you who's competing... (a beat, as Kirk reacts) You pulled every string in the book short of blackmail to get the Enterprise -- maybe even that. And when this mission is over, you have no intention of giving her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight) I intend to keep her, is that what you're saying, Doctor? McCOY It's an obsession -- that can blind you so far more immediate -- and critical responsibilities. Your reaction to Decker is an example.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk studies him a beat; has McCoy touched a nerve? Something Kirk himself might have been unaware of? Kirk starts speaking, but is interrupted by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge to Captain.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE CABIN VIEWER
dialogues.text: as Kirk turns to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his VOICE COMMAND, the viewer comes on with AN IMAGE of Uhura at her console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal from a Federation-registered long-range shuttle, sir. She wishes to come alongside, and lock on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the viewer, Chekov's IMAGE replaces Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a courier, Captain. Grade One priority. Non-belligerency confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, Mr. Chekov, see to it. Viewer off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer IMAGE FADES. Kirk turns back to McCoy whose question of Kirk's fitness still hangs there between them. Eye to eye - then, finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Your... opinion has been noted, Doctor. (beat) Is there anything further? McCOY I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk nods, exits. McCoy watches him go, hoping his point has gotten through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: traveling at a rapid speed; it carries warp-capacity nacelles which dwarf the smaller  to 10 position shuttle fuselage. The CAMERA HOLD ON THE SHUTTLE as it overtakes the Enterprise, the ENTERPRISE COM- ING INTO VIEW, and the shuttle slowing and beginning to move between the starship's giant nacelles.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTERPRISE AND THE SHUTTLE, (S)
dialogues.text: About the size of a fighter airplane floating in over the vastness of an aircraft carrier. The shuttle slows further, hovering now. Then its fuselage pod detaches from the warp drive nacelles -- the pod moving slowly but precisely toward the starship's command airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we HEAR the CLANK and WHOOSH of the AIRLOCK MECHAN- ISM. Chekov is standing by  with a security man. A moment later the hatch slips open - TO REVEAL Spock. A proud Spock, impassively Vulcan, almost contemptuously aloof. His hair is now trimmed in neat Vulcan style; he wears Vulcan attire simple, civilian, utilitarian.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to come aboard, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granted, sir! Granted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is already moving out of the pod entry area, im- passive, no greeting on his lips; no friendship in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulling away from Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open, and there is Spock. It takes everyone a moment to believe their eyes. Then, the Bridge crew AD LIB their surprise and pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock...! Spock, where...how...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, smiling, is moving toward Spock with hand out- stretched. But Spock has already turned and moved toward the science console where Decker sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, if I may...?

dialogues.speaker: 150A AT SCIENCE CONSOLE
dialogues.text: It takes Decker a moment to realize that Spock wants to take over the console. He begins getting to his feet, throwing Kirk a look. But Kirk's attention is totally on SPOCK. And Spock is already intent on com- putations he is beginning to punch into the science console computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been monitoring your Starfleet transmissions, Captain, your engine design difficulties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock continues to punch information into the science computer -- a monitor screen IMAGE begins to show com- plex equations which Spock inspects -- he makes a further computer punch out and inspects a second  monitor IMAGE of other equations. Only then does Spock seem to become aware of Kirk and Decker standing there with questioning expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I offer my services as Science Officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk starts to grin -- then remembers to wipe it off his face as he turns to Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If our Executive Officer has no objections...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Of course not. I'm aware of Mister Spock's qualifications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning openly now; turns, calls) Mister Chekov, log Mister Spock's Starfleet commission reactivated; list him as Science Officer; both effective immediately.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE ELEVATOR DOORS
dialogues.text: as they SNAP open -- McCoy and Chapel appear. Chapel sees Spock at the science console -- she moves in quickly, overjoyed. Even McCoy seems pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock...!!! McCOY So help me, I'm actually pleased to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as Chapel crosses to Spock, her pleased smile brightening her whole face, Spock turns, dismisses her presence with a cold disinterested glance -- Chapel stops, stands dumbfounded. Spock gives McCoy a similar glance - turns back to his console readings as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how we all feel, Mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same cold glance causes Uhura to stop in mid- sentence. Several grins directed toward Spock are now fading from bridge crew faces. Spock has turned back again for a last quick reading at the console and now stands -- totally ignoring everyone else as he speaks coolly, unemotionally to Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your permission, I will now discuss these fuel equations with the Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk manages a nod, a bit dumbfounded himself at Spock's strange manner. Spock heads for the elevator -- puz- zled expressions from the entire bridge crew. Then Kirk calls after him, very sincerely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Spock, welcome aboard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock continues onto the elevator without any acknow- ledgment, leaves. Kirk glances, perplexed, at McCoy. McCoy, equally perplexed, shrugs. McCOY Never look a gift Vulcan in the ears, Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: traveling past the stars, sub-warp. OVER this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buoyant) Captain's Log. Stardate 7413.4. Thanks to Mr. Spock's timely arrival - and assistance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott making an intermix chamber reading with a hand- held timer-temperature device which emits SIGNALS while Spock now in regulation uniform and hair trim, makes adjustments in the circuitry of a panel complex. Dur- ing the following, they will react as if they've solved the engine problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) ... we have the engines rebalanced into full warp capacity. Repair time less than three hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu at the helm, accelerating; just a touch of tense- ness in crew as they move toward the speed which earlier threw them into the "wormhole" effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) ... which means we will now be able to intercept Intruder while still more than a day from Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stars accelerating as Sulu calls off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warp point eight... point nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The viewer shows the QUANTUM LEAP into warp drive. The stars ahead shift, streak and congeal into WARP EFFECT MASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Warp one, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others wait, then show relief as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
