dialogues.text: (continuing) Warp two, sir... warp three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues to seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engineering to Bridge... New intermix balance holding steady. She's not even straining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where, first, CAMERA SHOOTS THROUGH THE WINDOW, the myriad of stars, space, the whole magnificent vista. In the lounge, empty but for them, are Kirk and McCoy -- obviously awaiting Spock, who ENTERS and presents himself cold and aloof as before:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporting as ordered, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock remains standing, addresses Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I would appreciate Dr. McCoy absenting himself from this interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him here. (indicating) Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant, it looks like Spock will refuse. Then, he complies but sits formally, rigidly. He ignores McCoy totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've reported that you felt strong thought emotions. A group of minds from a space vessel? Could you make out any plan, anything to do with Earth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still formally) Negative, Captain. I could sense only what seemed an almost omniscient pattern of perfect logic. I can explain nothing more; I understand nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is clearly disappointed -- and a bit uncomfortable about what he must ask next. He exchanges a glance with McCoy, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also -- there was nothing in your report about why you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That inquiry invades my personal life, Captain. McCOY Spock, we've already guessed why you're here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I inquired about you -- learned you were studying with the Masters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although Spock has been almost infuriatingly emotionless, his expression shifts slightly. McCoy indicates this: McCOY That flicker of emotion confirms our guess. You failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (facing McCoy for the first time) Your deductions do you credit, Doctor... if your puerile curiosity does not. McCOY (not in amusement) And now, anger, Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock looks straight ahead -- his face instantly com- posed to almost total blankness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; nods) I still contain fragments of my human half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And whatever you sensed out here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is my only hope of accomplishing what the Masters could not. McCOY If you achieve perfect logic, Spock, you'll pay a price. It's given your planet ten thousand years of peace, but no poetry's been written since then, no music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock has come to his feet fast - but Kirk is on his feet too, confronting him. During which:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it drop, Bones. (to Spock) You are my Science Officer -- I'll expect an immediate report on anything further you learn or sense from here on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have accepted service here as a Starfleet officer... sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I know this has been painful, Spock. For me too. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock EXITS. Kirk and McCoy exchange a troubled look, then EXIT too as CAMERA CENTERS AGAIN ON OBSERVATION WINDOW, the view of space there.

dialogues.speaker: CHEKOV'S HAND
dialogues.text: pushing red alert. The ALERT SOUNDS; the red lights begin FLASHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red alert! Red alert!

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDING MAIN VIEWER
dialogues.text: All regulars in position (different uniforms), extra CREW hurrying in from elevators to man the remainder of the console positions. Decker is making a bridge circuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full mag on viewer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu hits a control -- viewer seems to ZOOM AHEAD and in the distance we SEE a point of light which grows into the LUMINESCENT CLOUD. The same as seen by the Klingons and Starfleet's Epsilon Nine station. Myster- ious, beautiful, and menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Linguacode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuing friendship messages on all frequencies, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All decks and divisions confirm status red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat, impassive) We are being scanned, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK, (AND DECKER)
dialogues.text: as Kirk whirls toward Spock's station, calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not return scan, Mr. Spock! It may be misinterpreted as hostility!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intruder scans emanate from the exact cloud center. Energy of a type entirely un- known to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) No response to friendship messages, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I go to battle stations, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, We'll take no prov- ocative action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker has reacted sharply, disapprovingly, to this:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recommend defensive posture, Captain: Screens and shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... (pause) ... that could also be misinter- preted as hostile, Mr. Decker. (to Spock) Cloud composition, Mr. Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve power energy field --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in disbelief) -- twelve power?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently) Captain, we've seen what their weapons can do. Shouldn't we  take every possible precaution -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Decker....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Captain, I suspect there's an object at the heart of that cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool) Mr. Decker, I will not provoke  an attack, If that order isn't  clear to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting in mid sentence) Captain, as your Exec, it's my duty to point out alternatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of thought from Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes to Cloud boundary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look) I stand corrected Mr. Decker. (toward Ilia) Navigator, lay in a conic section flight path into the cloud center; bring us parallel to whatever we find in there...

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING THE VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: The Cloud has now grown so large it DOMINATES THE ENTIRE VIEWER. Sulu hits a button, reducing magnif- cation. Immediately, the CLOUD diminishes in size -- but almost instantly begins GROWING AGAIN. Decker's annoyance (with Kirk) suddenly seems to dissipate as his total attention is diverted to the cloud.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK, DECKER AND KIRK
dialogues.text: Decker turning to Spock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That measures twelve power? Ten thousands of starships couldn't  generate that much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker trails his words, realizing that Spock isn't hearing a word. Spock's attention is on the O.S. main viewer, totally absorbed by something he's feeling. He is slowly rising from his seat, stepping forward -- Kirk becomes conscious of this, turns and sees Spock's strange expression. Before he can speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have... they have been communicating with us. I sense ... puzzlement. Why have we not replied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communicated with us how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock shakes his head... then reacts as if sensing or theorizing something further. He turns, moves quickly to his console, begins there as if searching for somethin Interrupted by another ALARM KLAXON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal medical alert, Mister Chekov!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming fire. Ahead. Zero,  ... mark, zero. Incoming fire. Ahead. Zero, mark, zero.

dialogues.speaker: FULL ON THE MAIN VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: showing a WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT streaking from the Cloud!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forcefields now...! Deflectors up full!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commencing evasive maneuvers... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge begins to tilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forcefields and deflectors up full, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT speeds toward the Enterprise, which veers sharply away now -- but WHIPLASH FOLLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT on the main viewer, closer and closer -- heading straight-on for the Star- ship. From the Bridge a CACOPHONY OF VOICES AND SOUNDS, but all organized and disciplined with the BRIDGE LIGHTING DIMMING and then as though traveling  the last short distance (actually several million miles) in the wink of an eye -- the WHIPLASH OF ENERGY STRIKES. The bridge lights go out. In the sudden darkness, the main viewer is all at once  a frantic, furious, pattern of GREEN-WHITE FLARING ENERGY accompanied by an EXPLOSIVE SHRILLING SOUND. It seems to  cling to the forcefields, the incredible energy of the forcefield barriers.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING CHEKOV'S STATION, (O)
dialogues.text: as a sheet of GREEN WHIPLASH ENERGY bursts from Chekov's console -- a LASH of FLAME engulfs Chekov's arm. Automatic fire control nozzles SPURT FOAM over him as he falls twisting and groaning in pain. Ilia reacts first, crossing quickly to assist Chekov -- Decker joins her, taking over Chekov's console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHEET OF WRITHING-GREEN ENERGY enveloping the entire vessel, outlining it starkly. (And outlining, too, the forcefield screens and deflectors -- batter- ing at them, seeking some gap through which to penetrate.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge still darkened, and on the viewer the WHIP- LASH ENERGY splattering the entire viewing screen with GREEN ENERGY BRILLIANCE, forcing all to shield their eyes against the impossible glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smoking panel BURSTS INTO A SHOWER OF SPARKS AND FLAME, spewing over and past Scott and his crew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bypass...! Alternate Integrators!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as, first on the viewer, the WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT EFFECT clings another moment then begins FADING. And then it is gone. The bridge lights go on again. Elevator doors open. Doctor Chapel and Medical Corps- men arrive and cross immediately to where Ilia tends to the injured Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new screens held...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engineering to bridge; we cannot hold full power on forcefields; deflector power is down seventy percent!

dialogues.speaker: 173A CHEKOV'S STATION
dialogues.text: Over the following, we will HEAR Captain Kirk AD LIB order; "Divert auxiliary systems power to deflectors!" and SCOTT INTERCOM VOICE answer: "All auxiliary power to deflectors, sir." Meanwhile, Chapel and Corpsmen giving medical treatment to Chekov who is in agony. Chapel is about to give an injection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can stop his pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Deltan woman takes Chekov's upper arm in both her hands, kneading her fingers deep into nerve centers -- Chekov's pain begins to quickly recede and he is almost startled by the sudden relief. Doctor Chapel, now spraying plasti-skin on the burned hand and wrist, gives Ilia a surprised, approving look and a flicker of female friendship passes between the Deltan and Earth woman. (setting up a later story point)

dialogues.speaker: VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: The energy brilliance gone now, we can SEE the CLOUD is very close -- the closest we have seen it yet, and the Aurora effect is spectacular; a vast, dense blan- ket of SPARKLING, FLARING COLOR.

dialogues.speaker: EMPHASIZING SPOCK
dialogues.text: whirling abruptly in his chair, addressing Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the Intruder has been attempting to communicate! Now placing their transmission on the speaker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately, from the SPEAKER we HEAR a SHRILL, IN- CREDIBLY FAST BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... frequency more than one million megahertz at such high speed their entire message lasts only a millisecond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapel and Corpsman are assisting Chekov from the bridge (we'll have SEEN that the remarkable plasti- skin sprayed on his hand has completley covered the ugly burn marks - he is even able to move his fingers a bit). Ilia returns to her station -- a relief CREW WOMAN takes over from Decker at Chekov's console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: so we can SEE in more detail Spock's monitor -- various oscillating waves, and HEAR more of the SHRILL BEEPS as  Spock manipulates his equipment, and continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suspect our messages were too slow for them to be noticed. (touches a control) Programming computer to send linguacode at their rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker has hurried in to assist the science console. Spock indicates a console area -- Decker works there -- Spock works another section of console buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cloud ever closer to the ship now, which is a mere dot in space compared to the immensity of the energy- seething, continuous color-exploding Cloud. And then, suddenly, from the Cloud -- ANOTHER WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT. Bearing down upon the Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the oncoming WHIPLASH BOLT is SEEN emerging from the Cloud. In the b.g., ALARM KLAXONS are SOUNDING,  alert lights flashing, etc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming fire. Ahead, zero, mark, zero, point two. Incoming fire.  Ahead, zero, zero, mark, zero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Engineering... what's happening to our forcefields?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much frenetic activity here, previous damage being repaired, the main shaft GLOWING BLUE-WHITE, ENGINES THROBBING AT FULL POWER, and a harassed Scott at the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systems are overloading, Captain! Our shields cannot handle another attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WHIPLASH BOLT streaking toward the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Mr. Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impact in fifteen seconds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock -- Decker assisting -- works frantically. Spock is clearly dissatisfied, shakes his head tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmit, Mr. Spock! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten seconds....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Spock hits the "transmit" button, and we HEAR the SHRILL BEEP SOUND (lasting but a fraction of a second), and Decker calls to Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmitting...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... five seconds.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: where the WHIPLASH BOLT is now BRILLIANT, almost upon us! Then the WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT abruptly VANISHES. In the blink of an eye, the entire EFFECT IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: REACTIONS
dialogues.text: relief, incredulity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears that our message has been understood, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Uhura) Any reply from them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, no reply, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning to Spock) Spock, have you sensed anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock turns, gives the O.S. viewer a glance. Then he shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 'puzzlement' I sensed was fleeting... minor... (ponders, then) ... as if carrying a sense of our insignificance, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our... 'insignificance'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All have reacted to this; Kirk exchanges a look with Spock who nods firmly. Then Kirk sees that both Decker and Sulu are throwing him a questioning look. In b.g. McCoy and Chapel have EXITED bridge with Chekov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are obviously confronted by a highly advanced mentality... yet they cannot understand who we are, or what we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they understood our messages; they broke off the attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They may have attacked only as a warning to us, Captain. To keep away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would presuppose a feeling, Commander... compassion. I sensed no emotion, only... (reverentially) ... pure logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk peers at Spock hoping for some assistance on the decision; but Spock merely peers back at him ex- pressionlessly: the decision is Kirk's. Kirk faces Spock one last beat, then turns and starts back to- ward his chair, calling to Ilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical plot on viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where the IMAGE of the "powerfield Cloud: changes to a tactical plot of Enterprise's conic flight path ap- proach. It shows a large schematic of the Cloud itself as well as a series of FAINTLY BLINKING schematics of various recent positions and directional attitudes of the Enterprise during its approach. These blinking Enterprise schematics show that the starship has  gone from a head-on approach to the Cloud into a (tech. advice) skidding movement around the Cloud (the star- ship always heading directly toward Cloud center), with the last Enterprise positions now showing it ap- roaching the Cloud from a quartering rear approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds to Cloud boundary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opinion, Mister. Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recommend we proceede, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Decker... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I advise caution, Captain; we  can't withstand another attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing is twenty hours from Earth. We know nothing about it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker glances around, moves close to Kirk so only Spock is able to overhear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's precisely the point,  Captain. We don't know  it will do. Moving into the cloud -- at this time, is  an unwarranted gamble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you define unwarranted, mister?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked my opinion, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk looks at him, then at Spock, who once more is peering in momentary concentration at the viewer, feels Kirk's gaze -- and turns to him, again expres- sionlessly; it's up to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds to Cloud Boundary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer, standard ahead.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: Main viewer IMAGE reverts to the "powerful cloud." All peer in grim fascination at the cloud another moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 187   Kirk sits contemplating his next move. Once again, decision is his. He looks to the Viewer a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Helm) Mr. Sulu, steady as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Enterprise slowly enters deeper toward the chamber ahead. We SEE the sheer size of the Cloud as opposed to that of the small ship now entering unknown territory. As the Enterprise enters the Cloud:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Viwscreen we SEE a vast array of IMAGES, spiralling  IMAGES, changing in size, shape, colour. Its walls  spinning and turning, looping and twisting, as the  Enterprise proceeds further Into the Cloud.  Amazed bridge crew members can do nothing but awe at  the sight before thier eye's. Even Spock has turned to  view the sight now illuminating the View screen. Kirk  sits pondering, amazed, thinking "What comes next?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving slowly through the maze of VISUAL'S seen from  the Main Viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the CLOUD OBSCURES all now. Everyone gazes at the viewer, almost mesmerized by the shifting violet power- field displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at viewer, frustrated, awed) No vessel could generate a  powerfield of this magnitude...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instruments fluctuating, Captain. Patterns unrecognizable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain....!

dialogues.speaker: SULU
dialogues.text: Sulu peering toward O.S. main viewer, his eyes wide with incredulity.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER REACTIONS
dialogues.text: Crew peering at O.S. main viewer with expressions of near disbelief. Similar reactions as Kirk and Decker turn too, reacting to:

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE ON MAIN VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: (V'GER THEME MUSIC UP) The Cloud "Aurora" EFFECT rapidly thinning -- in the "eye of the hurricane" center of the Cloud is the object which has stunned the entire bridge crew. Rapidly growing in size -- already frighteningly huge. Totally alien in look. Its enormous bulk is irrides- cent, faintly glowing, suggesting that it is made up of exotic combinations of matter, and energy far beyond the scientific knowledge or ability of Earth's 23rd Century technology. Menacing and yet strangely beautiful, both at the same time.

197 The Object continues to GROW RAPIDLY IN SIZE as the Enterprise continues moving toward it. Everyone is awed; even Spock, from whom we discern an involuntary, impressed reaction. Decker is with Spock at the science console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible dimensions, Sir! ... I make it as seventy-eight kilometers in length...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All digest the dimensions, as:

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE ELEVATOR DOORS
dialogues.text: opening to admit McCoy and Chekov, whose face and hands are taut with plastiskin applications. Seeing the object on the viewer (O.S. at this ANGLE), Chekov's eyes open with wide astonishment. He crosses quickly to his weapons--defense station, his eyes on the viewer. McCoy, eyes also fixed on the sight, moves to Kirk's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could hold a crew of tens of thousands...! McCOY Or just one thousand, ten  miles tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evaluation, Mister Spock?

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK TO SPOCK
dialogues.text: (This will be the first time we've seen Spock dislay- ing a definite reaction, almost an emotion.) So engrossed is Spock in the main viewer IMAGE that he appears not to have heard Kirk, whose AD LIBS a sharp "Mr. Spock...!" Spock looks absently at Kirk an instant, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awed; compelled) That vessel is generating a forcefield measurably greater than the radiation of the Earth's sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Uhura) Transmit image of the Alien to Starfleet; advise we are attempting further communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Unable to make contact with Starfleet. Our transmissions out of the Cloud are being reflected back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distance to object now seventy- thousand kilometers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning; concerned) We're closing in on it rapidly, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concern reflected on the faces of others too. Kirk considers his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRAVELING WITH ENTERPRISE as it moves on a parallel--closing course -- Alien continues to GROW IN SIZE. Although it already seems an impossibly large vessel compared to the Enterprise, in reality they are still tens of thousands of kilometers apart; the incredible size of the Alien is nowhere near being realized yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tension high as -- the Alien now appears so close that its IMAGE MORE THAN FILLS VIEWER. Considerable tension of bridge -- crew members, throwing nervous looks from viewer to Kirk. How much closer?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reduce magnification. Factor 4, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy) We're already two settings below that, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts, then) Adjust parallel course, Navigator. Bring us in to one hundred kilometers distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nervous looks now directed toward Kirk. Even Spock gives him a glance, a raised eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien Object appears A DOZEN TIMES LARGER THAN ENTERRISE and still GROWING IN SIZE. We begin to SEE Alien exterior detailing which had not even been suspected at a longer distance. The Enterprise is now quartering in toward the Intruder, coming closer and closer. The Alien vessel is still GROWING IN SIZE -- more and more, its exterior appears to be made of substances never before seen by a human eye -- substances considered possible only in the wildest flights of scientific theory -- plasma-matter, energy fields diamond--hard in their power, solid sheets of subatomic particles, crystalline-lace patterns which seem capable of shifting their nature and rearranging themselves.

dialogues.speaker: INTRUDER
dialogues.text: This time, the Enterprise travels on away from us, as its course takes it angling nearer and nearer the gigantic Alien Intruder -- the Starship dwindling in size, growing smaller, smaller, smaller... until it is a tiny dot compared to the enormity of the Alien vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are coming alongside the mid-section of the Alien vessel, now so huge that only a small section of it now completely fills main viewer frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hundred kilometers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold relative position here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's voice is blotted out by a DEAFENING, SHRILL- ING SOUND, accompanied by a multi-hued point of LIGHT which EXPLODES into BLINDING INTENSITY, obscuring everything for an instant. Overlapping this action, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intruder alert...!  Intruder alert!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continues.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLASMA ENERGY PROBE, (O)
dialogues.text: The BLINDING LIGHT FADES and in its lace we SEE a strange "entity" shocking us with its frightening appearance and its ugly-sounding THROBBING HUM of power. It is about seven feet tall and resembles a "blob" of raw energy in shifting patterns and colors of deep, ugly hues of upper spectrum violet. Yet, it looks strangely alive. At the end of the "tendril" (of light) is an "eye" (a small multi-colored device)

dialogues.speaker: CREW REACTIONS
dialogues.text: The bridge crew reacting hard, shocked and shaken -- the THROBBING SOUND of the Alien thing intensifies as it begins to move across the bridge. Suddenly, in b.g., an elevator door snaps oen and two SECURITY MEN burst onto the bridge, phasers drawn. Chekov shouts warningly at the Men:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No weapons...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Chekov is too late: First Security Man FIRES -- the BLAST harmlessly absorbed by the Probe which emits a SCREECHING nerve-grating SOUND --- sends out a SMALL WHIPLASH ENERGY BOLT which instantly envelopes First Security Man in a PURPLE GLOW (of implosion). Second Security Man has almost lifted his phaser -- but now carefully, slowly is moving his hand away from his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PURPLE GLOW FADES, the First Security Man has simply vanished.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Chekov, like the others, horrified, flips a switch and the COMPUTER-VOICE ("Intruder Alert") goes OFF. At the same time Chekov speaks into his intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security... do not send further teams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Probe is sending out snake-like tendrils to the various consoles on the bridge. These tendrils lash out in a cobra-strike movement, the tendril-head seeming to enter into the console affected -- at which time all monitors and instrument lights there come ON as if the Probe is "reading" each console function. The crew carefully stays clear of the tendrils. Spock has risen, moving to Kirk's side as he slowly brings his tricorder up, very carefully extracting its tiny sensor and aiming it at the probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) No intruder readings on other decks, Captain... (to Spock) Can that be one of their crew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) A probe from their vessel... (to Kirk) A plasma-energy combination...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the probe is now hovering near Chekov who sits frozen, fists clenched, jaw tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't interfere with it...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely, I will not interfere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the "probe" withdraws an energy-tendril from one bridge station and "inserts" it into another console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one interfere...! It doesn't seem interested in us -- only the ship...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's words are never completed as suddenly all the energy tendrils withdraw from all consoles and a larger, more powerful-looking tendril lashes out, snaking into the science console complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where, also immediately, all the console and computer lights are suddenly flashing wildly, rapidly -- -- There is an incredibly fast EXCHANGE OF HIGH-PITCHED BEES -- the computer obviously in unauthorized commu- nication with the probe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's taken control of the computer...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's running our records! Starfleet strength, Earth defenses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Decker moves to the main power control, Spock now steps in, his Vulcan strength easily brushing Kirk and Decker aside. Spock clasps his fists above his head, brings it down in a SHATTERING BLOW on the console. It splits open! As the bridge lights dim even more, and as the science console shorts itself out -- and off, Decker confronts Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could have cut it off at the main computer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This served the purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk has been giving Spock a puzzled look -- Spock now turns abruptly, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Spock, in stepping back, accidentally brushes the probe's energy tendril -- a FLASH OF LIGHT at the contact point sends Spock sinning under the rail and to the floor near Ilia. The probe's energy-tendril has withdrawn from the darkened science console, hov- ers high over the dazed Spock as if angrily seeking the reason for the break in its computer contact. Spock starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, don't move...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker steps toward her, AD LIBBING a grim "Ilia...!" But he has no chance as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Probe hovers over her, its whole mass seemingly about to envelope her with a single tendril extended toward her, somehow freezing her into immobility - and then the entire Probe DISSOLVES IN A BLINDING  FLASH OF WHITE, obscuring Ilia. Almost instantly the WHITE FLASH FADES -- but Ilia has vanished -- her tricorder clattering to the deck.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE NAVIGATOR'S STATION TO KIRK AND DECKER
dialogues.text: helpless, shocked, gazing at the place Ilia was -- but which is now empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk, quiet  fury) This is how I define unwarranted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And almost at the same moment a new BRIDGE ALARM SIGNAL.

232 233   The ALARM still sounding as from the giant alien ve sel, we SEE STRANGE, OPAQUE ENERGY PATTERNS STREAKING TOWARD US. Kirk vaults to the command chair, lunges for controls, as Decker races to the weapons-defense console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice amplified) The ship is under attack...! Man all defensive stations...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forcefields, full remaining strength...! Total reserve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appropriate ALARM KLAXONS, and COMPUTER VOICES begin SOUNDING, and all this is lost in a SUDDEN SHRILLING SOUND (a constant, high-pitched tone). For a moment the energy patterns are prominent on the viewer -- and then the PATTERNS VANISHED and the SHRILL SOUND FADES -- and:

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR THE VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: showing V'ger GROWING RAPIDLY IN SIZE. The Enterprise is being pulled along the length of the big ship, toward its "prow."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we have been seized by a tractor beam...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Decker) Get someone up here to take the Navigator's station...! (into intercom) Engineering... full emergency power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Chief Difalco to the bridge; on the double!

dialogues.speaker: 234A ENGINEERING
dialogues.text: in a state of controlled chaos, all personnel at their stations, the Engine CORE GLOWING. Scott is working his controls, speaking into the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going to full emergency... (studying readings) But Captain, if we don't break free in fifteen seconds, she'll burn up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Spock studies his readings, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot break free, Captain. (indicates monitors) We do not have a fraction of the power necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Delay that order, Scotty...! Disengage all main drive systems!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock peers in deep concentration at the Main Viewer, trying to sense some clue. Kirk glances at him another moment, then turns to the Main Viewer himself, watches in frustrated helplessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the starship being pulled toward the giant as though on a taut cable. As we MOVE CLOSER, we SEE still more intricate details of the incredible Alien design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Difalco arrives on the run, and Decker AD LIBS to her, "Assume Navigator's station, Chief...!" Difalco, bewildered, wants to ask what happened, but no time, and she quickly sits at the post, begins orienting herself. Meanwhile, Decker has begun an Executive Officer's bridge circuit, assisting with various con- soles. Kirk is glancing toward Spock who continues concentrating on the Viewer, striving to comprehend the myriad of thoughts he is sensing from he Aliens. McCoy also arrives on the bridge, takes in the chaotic scene, watches the Viewer grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the forward end of the giant, an odd-shapped "iris" begins opening menacingly. And it is frighteningly obvious that the tractor beam is pulling the Enterprise to the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: showing the unusual "iris" now almost fully open as Enterprise is drawn closer, closer -- through the "iris" we now SEE (some of) V'ger's interior: a dark void relieved only by strange flickering glows of dis- tant ENERGY FIELD PATTERNS. The crew reacts with understandable awe, apprehension, curiosity, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, suggest a maximum phaser strike directly at the beam might weaken it just enough for us to break free --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock replies for Kirk: quickly, as though to make his point convincingly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break free to where, Commander...? (to Kirk) Any show of resistance would not only be futile, Catain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 240XA   ACROSS SPOCK TO KIRK (DECKER AND McCOY IN B.G.) as Kirk reacts somewhat curiously to Spock's remark, but it is Decker who articulates it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (troubled; suspicious) We don't know that, Mr. Spock. Why are you opposed to trying? Before Spock can reply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're pulling us inside...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All face the Viewer again, react, with McCoy who has been observing all these reactions now galvanized into action: McCOY (to Chekov) Medical observers to all decks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hurries toward the elevators, CAMERA WITH HIM a moment, then SWINGING BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: 240A PAST KIRK TO VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: Kirk staring at the viewer -- the "iris" now fully open so that the exterior of V'ger is no longer visible -- and all we can SEE is the monstrous void dead ahead, which is looming faster and larger before our eyes. And now we are inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise now being pulled past the opening -- into the ship proper. Now we can SEE that the dark void is actually a vast chamber, dimly and intermittently lit by POWERFIELDS appearing and vanishing along the vessel's inner walls, which are miles away in the  distance. And here and there in the chamber gigantic ENERGY DISPLAYS erupt briefly with a certain symmetry that suggests they must be part of V'ger's ower or control systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk peering awed at the Viewer, the incredible sight of the chamber -- suddenly glances up to see that Spock is standing beside him -- Decker nearby, turns to Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spock) Why bring us inside? Not to destroy us; they could have  done that outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could have many ways of destroying things, Mr. Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering at Viewer) Something about us puzzles them... perhaps even concerns them.

dialogues.speaker: UHURA
dialogues.text: Reacting to a console reading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, photic-sonar readings indicate the aperture is closing; we're trapped, sir...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The starship is pulled inside, the "iris" is closing behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The viewer image changing from the huge dark chamber, rear angle shot, showing the "iris" closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse angle on the viewer, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the viewer the final glimmer from exterior space as the "iris" closes completely.

dialogues.speaker: REACTIONS
dialogues.text: All eyes on the viewer, CAMERA FINDING ONE FACE AFTER ANOTHER, the reality of the situation etched into each face. Then:

dialogues.speaker: 248A FAVORING KIRK
dialogues.text: As Spock turns from a reading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tractor beam has released us, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmed: Vessel is floating free. No forward momentum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewer ahead, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN VIEWER
dialogues.text: Ahead, the cavernous interior of V'ger.

dialogues.speaker: 248C BACK TO SHOT
dialogues.text: Kirk eying the main viewer -- Decker watching Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maneuvering thrusters, Mr. Sulu; ahead one third. (to Spock) Full sensor scan, Mr. Spock; they can't expect us not to look them over now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (manipulating controls) Thrusters ahead, one third.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (manipulating controls) Commencing sensor scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk rises, goes to Spock's station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise moving slowly forward in this vastness, its running lights merely specks of light, candles in the darkness. In the distance those occasional ERUPT- ING POWER DISPLAYS in distant locations, sizes, shapes and patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: showing another persective of the above, and further away GLOWING ENERGY FIELDS dimly illuminating the alien ship's walls -- miles away. Strange semi--solid LIGHT SHAPES (some are "sensor-bee" swarms) traverse the dark- ness in random directions. But in the distance ahead, there seems to be an opening to another chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of Viewer) Something ahead, sir; looks like another area... (reacts) It's closing up...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu is indicating what appears to be a lace-bulwark of POWERFIELD PATTERNS closing off the "chamber" in the distance ahead. Kirk, from the Science Station calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold station...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (manipulating controls) Thrusters at station keeping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at his Science consoles, working rapidly, shifting from one set of controls to another. Now he hits a master control -- his console monitors FLASH, then go dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock brings a monitor IMAGE ON again, indicates a (Povill) pattern showing a line hitting something, then reversing direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) All scans are being reflected back, Captain. Our sensors are useless.

dialogues.speaker: 251A ACROSS THEM TO THE MAIN VIEWER
dialogues.text: Kirk reacts with disappointment, indicates the main viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been able to analyze any of this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice increasingly reverential) I believe the light flares to be energy fields -- undoubtedly part of the vessel's inner mechanism. A technology so incredibly sophisticated that I cannot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Intruder Alert! Intruder Alert..! (continues)

dialogues.speaker: CHEKOV
dialogues.text: Reacting to a console reading:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deck four, Captain; Officers' Quarters...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chekov) Have a security team meet me at Deck Four main elevator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment's reaction from all at this, Kirk hurrying toward elevator, calling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Take the conn, Mr. Decker: Hold present position... (gesturing Spock to join him) Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spock rises, joins Kirk and they hurriedly exit, the CAMERA SWINGING BACK to Decker, his perplexed con- cern (because of Ilia).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we SEE, behind the translucent stall door, what is unmistakably the form of the NUDE FEMALE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: entering, Spock slightly behind him - and one Security Guard. Kirk glances around the room, now glances at the shower area and reacts as he sees the NAKED FORM. The others react similarly, even Spock cannot help re- pressing an expression of surprise. A moment's uncer- tainty as Kirk peers at them, then he steps to the stall door, hesitates another instant -- then slides the door open. (NOTE: Arrange lighting for bizarre, mysterious effect.) Kirk's eyes cannot believe what he is seeing:

dialogues.speaker: 255A "ILIA"
dialogues.text: standing in the sonic mist, naked but for a small multi-colored button embedded in her throat. As she looks at Kirk -- and the others -- the men peer back at her, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have been programmed by V'ger to observe and record normal functioning of the carbon-based units infesting USS ENTERPRISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk peers at her another nonplussed moment, then leans into the shower to touch a control, his eyes fixed on the lovely body behind the mist. He punches in a three digit code. Immediately a HUMMING SOUND emanates from the shower stall, Kirk closing the door, but 'Ilia" remaining inside.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK AND THE OTHERS TO THE SHOWER STALL
dialogues.text: The HUMMING SOUND just now reaching a gentle crescendo -- through the translucent door you can see COLORS ENVELOPING "ILIA'S" FORM. And now the SOUND STOPS. "Ilia", attired in a leisure robe, steps from the stall, into the room. She stands facing Kirk, her face impas- sive, eyes unblinking. He looks her back a moment, then glances at Spock, who is gazing at "Ilia" in abso- lute fascination. Kirk addresses her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is...'V'ger'...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger is that which programmed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is V'ger the Captain of the alien vessel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 256A   ANGLE ON THE DOOR - McCOY rushing in, concerned: McCOY Jim, what's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sight of 'Ilia", McCoy's words die in his throat -- and his trained eyes have instantly told him some- thing is awry. He unslings his tricorder, aims the sensor unit at "Ilia". As he reads his instruments, his face reveals the results (incredulity, fascination). Meanwhile, from the start:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger is that which seeks the Creator. McCOY (of "Ilia") Jim, this is a mechanism...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk stares at McCoy, then at "Ilia" and realizes that "Ilia" is indeed non-human. And quickly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Lt. Ilia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That unit no longer functions. I have been given its form to more readily communicate with the carbon-based units infesting Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Carbon-based units"...? McCOY (drily) Humans, Ensign Lang: us. (continues tricorder  exam, increasingly impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "Ilia") Why does V'ger travel to the third planet of the solar system directly ahead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger travels to the third  planet to find the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, disbelieving reactions as all four attempt to digest this -- Spock gazing at "Ilia" with even more rapt fascination. Kirk, bewildered, addresses the others:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the Creator? What Creator? Whose...!? (to "Ilia") What does V'ger want of the 'Creator'... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To join with him.

dialogues.speaker: 256B FAVORING SPOCK
dialogues.text: suddenly alert, addressing "Ilia":

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join with the Creator... ? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger and the Creator will become One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is the Creator? McCOY (worried) Mr. Spock, be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creator is that which created V'ger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is V'ger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger is that which seeks the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another moment of total exasperation, frustration, during which "Ilia" seems to be waiting politely, patiently for any further questions. When none are forthcoming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; pleasant, bland) I am ready to commence my observations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast; to McCoy) Doctor, a thorough examination of this probe might provide some insight into those who manufactured it, and how to deal with them. McCOY Let's get her to sickbay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he grasps "Ilia's" arm to escort her. But is as though he has seized cast iron: immovable. McCoy is thrown off balance merely by 'Ilia's" remaining sta- tionary. She ignores McCoy, addresses Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am programmed to observe and record normal functioning procedures of the carbon-based units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 256B   Kirk glances at McCoy, who is totally bemused, but Kirk quickly responds to "Ilia":

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The examination is a normal function.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) You may proceede. McCOY (carefully) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: EXAMINING ROOM VIEWER, (O)
dialogues.text: scanning a "body". PULL BACK TO SHOW McCoy, Chapel, Kirk, Spock and Chekov -- standing over "ILIA" who lies prone on the table, the physicians moving the scanner over her. McCOY (from the start; indicating) ... micro-miniature hydraulics, sensors, molecule-sized multi- processor chips... and look at this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., Decker enters, grimly observes the proceed- ings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) An osmotic micro-pump... here and here. Even the smallest body functions are exactly duplicated. (traces with finger on screen) And every exocrine system is here, too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chapel breaks off abruptly, noticing "Ilia" is peering intently -- almost with a glimmer of recognition -- at Decker. Slightly disconcerted, Chapel continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) -- even eye moisture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering at Decker) Deck -- er.

dialogues.speaker: 257A FAVORING SPOCK
dialogues.text: as everyone reacts to "Ilia's" utterance of Decker's name. It seems to make the deepest impression on Spock, confirming something he has suspected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "Ilia") Interesting. Not 'Decker-unit'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" continues peering at Decker with just a hint of a puzzled frown, a glimmer of distant recognition. It's the first time we've seen her expression look anything but cool and bland. This results in the quizzical rising of one of Spock's eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy's examination now turns "Ilia" away from the others. Spock quickly catches Kirk's and Decker's attention, indicates an adjoining door -- they fol- low him out of the room. 259   INT. McCOY'S OFFICE as Kirk, Spock and Decker enter, the door snapping shut -- and Spock touching the electronic lock to secure them. He faces the others:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... this probe may be a key a key to the Aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a programmed mechanism, Mr. Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have just seen that its body duplicates our navigator in precise detail. Suppose that beneath its programming, the real Ilia's memory patterns are duplicated with equal precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had a pattern to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) ... they may have followed it too precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comprehending) Ilia's memory, her feelings of loyalty, friendship, obedience... might all be there.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER
dialogues.text: also comprehending, and not liking it one bit as Spock and Kirk are both turning their attention to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (to Decker) And you did have a 'relationship' with Lieutenant Ilia, Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That probe in there -- in a different form now -- is the same thing that killed Ilia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, we're locked in an alien vessel, six hours from Earth orbit, our only contact with our captors is the probe. If we can control it, persuade it, use it in some way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrupted by the SOUND of someone trying to open the locked door behind them. Then a METAL RIPPING SOUND as they whirl to see:

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL OFFICE DOOR
dialogues.text: with the METAL BUCKLING, TEARING -- and a single hand slicing the steel door like paper. It is the "Ilia" probe, her face absolutely impassive, her whole manner incongruously benign. (Behind her, a startled McCoy, Chapel and Chekov.) "Ilia" speaks flatly, blandly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have recorded enough here. (motions to Kirk) You will now assist me further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk exchanges a quick glance with Spock. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Decker) The Decker-unit can assist you with much greater efficiency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" has seemed about to object -- but now her eyes hold on Decker. Then she nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Carry on with your assignment, Mr. Decker.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS DECKER TO THE SMASHED DOOR
dialogues.text: (AND "ILIA")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Decker looks at "Ilia" who stands at the torn door. You can read Decker's mind: I'm supposed to persuade that?! He turns back, finds Kirk's eyes on him. Decker nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" and a reluctant Decker EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: 260B EMPHASIZING SPOCK
dialogues.text: looking very troubled as they watch Decker and "Ilia" leave. Kirk notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock? Concerned about his chances?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am uneasy with that being our only hope of more information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: floating in the vast, eerie, alien chamber -- sporadic FLASHES OF ENERGY, erupting now and then. Various other EFFECTS. OVER this, Kirk's VOICE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's Log. Stardate 7414.1. Our best estimates place us some four hours from Earth. No significant Ilia memory patterns within the alien probe. This remains our only means of contact with our captor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area dimly lit -- unoccupied but for a lone AIRLOCK TECHNICIAN checking and adjusting instruments. The CAMERA MOVES PAST him to FIND:

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: His face fixed with grim determination, walking quietly with obvious intent not to attract the Tech's attention. Now he steals up behind the TECH -- and in an instant has applied a Vulcan nerve pinch. The Tech slumps over his console.

dialogues.speaker: INT KIRK'S CABIN
dialogues.text: Showing a CLOSE SHOT of ENTERPRISE PICTURES, then PULL BACK SLIGHTLY for an IMAGE of Decker and "Ilia" walk- ing through the Rec Deck. PULL BACK FURTHER TO SHOW Kirk watching this -- and with him is McCoy. They continue watching a troubled beat, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of pictures) All these vessels were called "Enterprise".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" is giving the pictures a very interested look as we HEAR in Kirk's cabin:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlled excitement) Bridge to Captain...

dialogues.speaker: B.G.
dialogues.text: Uhura at her console, struggling to hear the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., Spock's station a MAINTENANCE TEAM is replacing the broken Science Station computer. (Spock is conspicuously absent.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint signal from Starfleet, sir. They have the intruder on their monitors... (struggling to  hear) They show us... three hours... twenty-four minutes from Earth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru intercom) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker and "Ilia", the Rec Deck unoccupied but for a pair of wary SECURITY GUARDS at a very discreet dis- tance. They are near the pictures of the five Enter- prises, which should be FEATURED in this SHOT, as Decker waves his hand about the huge room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carbon units use this area for recreation... (carefully) What type of recreation does the crew aboard your vessel enjoy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As "Ilia" moves on into the room, Decker follows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words 'recreation' and 'enjoy' have no meaning to my programming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker peers at the lovely android with frustration -- and no little pain, for she is after all the exact replica of Ilia. She pays not the slightest attention to Decker's reaction, and begins walking about the Rec Deck taking in (and, clearly, transmitting all images to V'ger) the sights. They are near a game area (elec- tronic games), and now Decker points to one game, switches it on -- presses button to activate its LIGHTS and SOUNDS. "Ilia" watches interestedly as Decker operates the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilia 'enjoyed' this game... she nearly always won --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he demonstrates again, as "Ilia" steps to the device, deftly hits some buttons -- and for just an instant she turns to Decker with a momentary glimmer of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCoy watching with special interest: McCOY (approving) Good! He's using audial-visual association.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the words are not out of McCoy's mouth when "Ilia" says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This device serves no purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps away from the game; Decker's disappointment is evident. So is everyone elses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...! McCOY (nods grimly) She needs something else: something much more personal to stimulate memory patterns. Something with a more emotional tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk reacts to this, reflective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker waving back toward the general area of the Enterprise pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crews of the previous Enterprises were also carbon units. In what way is the life form in your vessel different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carbon units are not true life forms... Do those images repre- sent how Enterprise has evolved into its present form?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoping he's struck a responsive chord) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carbon units have clearly retarded Enterprise's proper evolvement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (controlling surprise) What is Enterprise's proper evolvement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise should not require the presence of carbon units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with this she moves off, observing other Rec Deck objects. Decker moves with her; then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (carefully) Enterprise would be unable to function without carbon units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More data concerning this functioning is necessary before carbon units can be patterned for data storage.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS "ILIA" TO DECKER
dialogues.text: as he reacts to this ominous note; he stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping; almost pleasantly) When my examination is complete,  the carbon units will be reduced  to data patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been delivered with chilling blandness, and she stands facing Decker, almost as though waiting for him to thank her. He thinks fast now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within you are memory patterns of a carbon unit. If I can help you revive these patterns; you could understand our functions better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is logical. You may procede.

dialogues.speaker: ON DECKER
dialogues.text: realizing the difficult task ahead; the pain he will suffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship stationary in the chamber as now we SEE an exterior hatch sliding fully open. Up through the hatch a circular airlock door opens -- and a tiny figure in a thruster spacesuit emerges, steps into space, slowly floats down through the hatch and under the Enterprise saucer section. In this and subsequent VIEWS we will SEE that on the rear pack of his thruster spacesuit is a FLASHING STROBE LIGHT which regularly EMITS the identifying SIGNAL of this particular suit. (By which Kirk will be able to see Spock's position even from several miles away.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING TOWARD the CAMERA until the features behind the face mask are clearly identifiable: Spock, his face set in the same grim, determined expression, as he touches his spacesuit transmitter control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, commence recording. Captain Kirk -- this message will detail my attempt to contact the aliens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk ENTERING, crossing Uhura as she calls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet signals, sir, growing in strength... (listening intently) They -- have Intruder on their monitors -- it's decelerating -- powerfield cloud beginning to dissipate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirm, Captain. Lunar beacons indicate Intruder on a course into Earth orbit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Sir! Airlock four has been opened; a thruster suit is reported missing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts knowingly) Spock...! (to navigator) Get a fix on his position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His features now set into an almost trance-like expres- sion as he concentrates on the thought emanations. Then we SEE his head turn, he peers off -- then he moves his thruster controls. We SEE the small blue jets of his thrusters -- his spacesuit figure begins to move off in the direction he was concentrating upon.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: His thrusters moving him across V'ger's vast chamber then dropping down into a deep "trough"-like area which stretches into the distance ahead of him. A cloud of CRYSTAL FORMS (Kirk's entrapment) become visible to one side but Spock passes them at some dis- tance and does not attract them. We can SEE more clearly now the point on the inner wall of the trough toward which Spock is heading. It is an unusual combination of GLOWING FORCEFIELDS which seem to mark this point of the vessel as of some importance. (Here, also, we will become aware of "sensor-bee" swarms, intermittently darting toward this same wall from all points of the chamber.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOWING Kirk in a thruster spacesuit, helmet being readied by AIRLOCK TECHNICIANS. McCoy is also here, arguing with Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the start) ... I don't want him stopped, Bones; I want him to lead me to whatever's out there...! McCOY And if that 'whatever' has taken over his mind....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he'll have still led me to it, won't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk steps into the airlock door, hits a control -- it begins sliding closed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UP THROUGH the circular airlock door as it slides open -- and Kirk's tiny spacesuited figure floats down clear of the saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEEING his face through the spacesuit faceplate as he scans the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge, Captain. We make Spock as 26 Mark 345 degrees off ship's axis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During which, Kirk spots something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's STROBE blinker at a mile or so distance, nearing V'ger's inner walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have him in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During which, Kirk touches his thruster controls and blue thruster jet propels him off in the direction indicated. His thrusters come on for a longer period of time as he accelerates to the higher speed necessary to overtake Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR SNAPPING open, and "Ilia", McCoy and Decker entering. Then CAMERA REVEALS Chapel already inside, looking through some female adornments she's found there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember Lt. Ilia once mentioning that she wore this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting; tight) ... when we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly this is very painful to Decker. Meanwhile, Chapel hands the Deltan headband to "Ilia".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" hasn't the slightest idea what to do with the headband, holds it, runs her fingers over the jewels and feathers embedded into it. Chapel takes it from her, places it on 'Ilia's" head, now switches on the light illuminating the dressing table mirror -- stands behind her with Decker, both watching apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: "ILIA"
dialogues.text: studying her image in the mirror, her face totally blank a moment, but then breaking into a bemused frown -- as though trying to remember. And:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpfully) Ilia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet; urging) On Delta... remember...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it seems that "Ilia" does remember. She peers at her image, then sets the headband into its exact proper position. Then she turns and looks at them with recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (haltingly) Dr. Chapel...

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS CHAPEL TO DECKER
dialogues.text: as Chapel smiles, pleased, and looks at Decker who stares at "Ilia" nonplussed. This is Ilia coming alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Decker) "Will..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she touches his hand, runs her own hand over it, and smiles. Decker is completely overwhelmed, struggles for words and looks to McCoy for some kind of help. McCoy realizes Decker is losing himself in fantasy. McCOY (gently reminding) Commander... this is a mechanism...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker is startled, and for another slit-second he's lost -- but then he realizes the reality, and what he should do:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently; but urgingly) Ilia, help us make direct contact with V'ger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker looks at "Ilia's" hand still resting on his. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell us who V'ger is; where he's from... W need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For another moment "Ilia" continues smiling at Decker, holding his hand. Then, abruptly, the smile vanishes -- the hand is released. Clearly, she's again the probe, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have two carbon units entered V'ger...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker glances at McCoy, who shakes his head almost imperceptibly: he doesn't know. But Decker has an obvious reply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want to make contact with V'ger... (trying to revive "Ilia's" memory again; touches her hand) Ilia...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" peers at him blankly, allows him to continue  touching her hand, but obviously it means nothing to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; distressed, to "Ilia") Does V'ger object to the presence of the two carbon units?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carbon units are of no consequence; V'ger will determine their purpose. McCOY Their purpose is to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is also V'ger's purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker's face reflects his bemusement:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said V'ger's purpose was to find and join with the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is how V'ger will survive.

dialogues.speaker: ON DECKER
dialogues.text: as now, the bemusement changes to just the slightest enlightenment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish to continue my observations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk but a small object, thruster jets occasionally spurting as he guides himself deeper into the trench as he continues forward progress in the direction he saw Spock taking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can SEE his face (through the plate), as he looks ahead into the distance toward Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's STROBE signal closer and Spock's tiny space- suited figure now becoming dimly visible as he moves steadily toward the GLOWING FORCEFIELDS of the inner wall.

dialogues.speaker: ON KIRK
dialogues.text: His attention fixed on Spock, he never notices until an instant too late an O.S. object; quickly he hits a thruster control, and we SEE the MANEUVERING JET turn him to the side as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swarm of strange-looking translucent crystal-like FORMS on a collision course with Kirk. (NOTE: They were traveling randomly, and are not deliberate ob- structions. However, Kirk's nearness now has attracted them and the swarm of them heads in his direction. Kirk tries to avoid them; he hits a second MANEUVERING JET -- but he overcompensates, and spins straight into the intercepting swarm of them.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK, (O)
dialogues.text: as the nearest crystal forms WHIP INTO SHOT, adhering to Kirk's spacesuit. He hits full MANEUVERING JETS now, seems to make some escape, but still more forms WHIP IN, adhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes anxiously on the O.S. main viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... stand by, I may be in trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu hits the viewer magnification control.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN VIEWER, (M)
dialogues.text: As the distant STROBE FLASHES of Kirk's spacesuit are MAGNIFIED CLOSER, pulling Kirk into MEDIUM LONG SHOT. We can SEE the details of the swarm of forms adhering. But we can SEE that Kirk's spacesuit is now about half covered with them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expressions of bridge crew to reflect the horror of what they're seeing as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your phaser, Captain...! Use your phaser...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (transmitter, weak) Can't... reach... phas -- (transmission breaks off in heavy STATIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airlocks two and four -- prepare to launch rescue teams! (glancing at viewer) Chief Lang! Get them out there! Fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, the Captain is in trouble, directly behind you -- three hundred meters! (beat) Mr. Spock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks of distress are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's spacesuited figure MOVING TOWARD the CAMERA, as we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak; STATIC) ... Spock...! ... need help...! ... trapped...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No indication at first that Spock has heard; his face set with determination, his eyes fixed on his destin- ation: the inner wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; weakening; STATIC) ... pressure on me...! ... can't move...! Spock...!

dialogues.speaker: ON SPOCK
dialogues.text: as Kirk's VOICE STOPS -- and all that is heard now is the HEAVY STATIC crackling ominously. Spock's expression flickers, then he hits reverse thruster JETS, stops -- he turns to glance at the inner wall, then his thrusters turn him so he can look back the way he came from. But he cannot resist Kirk's call; he suddenly hits his thruster controls, then JETS FLARE, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as thruster JETS accelerate him back toward Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: showing Kirk's spacesuit completely covered, encased in the blob. Kirk is no longer moving. But in the distance, facing toward him is Spock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Spock in the near distance, heading TOWARD the CAMERA. As he approaches Kirk, Spock brings out his phaser. Now he hits the controls for the REVERSE JETS -- he slows RAPIDLY as he approaches Kirk's now complete- ly encased spacesuit. Spock makes a quick phaser adjustment.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK AND KIRK'S ENCASED SPACESUIT, (O)
dialogues.text: Spock levels the phaser carefully. FIRES. The PHASER BEAM strikes the blob form -- it SHATTERS, the pieces DISINTEGRATING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: facing each other while hovering in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge, cancel rescue teams. (hard) Spock, what in the hell are you doing out here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am seeking answers, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with insight) Answers to what, Spock? Our dilemma -- or your personal one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock does not immediately reply, peers at Kirk through the faceplate a long beat, then abruptly looks away, points off into the distance:

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDING INNER WALL, (O)
dialogues.text: We can SEE what appear to be SPARKLING GLOBULES OF LIGHT darting toward the inner wall in the distance, then disappearing there. (We'll SEE other swarms occasionally too, coming from different directions -- they will later be identified as "sensor swarms" on closer examination.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Captain, I believe there we will find an indication of whoever -- or whatever -- is aboard this vessel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk weighs alternatives, then pushes his thruster controls and begins moving in the direction Spock indicated. Their thruster jets flash, propel them toward the  point on the inner wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most prominent area of the vast inner wall -- the patterns on the wall here seem to GLOW with life. The spacesuited figures of Kirk and Spock ENTER SCENE, gliding slowly toward what seems to be the central part of theses patterns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they approach and then we SEE the brief REVERSE THRUSTERS and then forward momentum stops; motionless. Then Spock sees something, indicates.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE SENSOR SWARM, (O)
dialogues.text: Now, we SEE that they are tiny, multi-colored points of FLASHING LIGHT -- almost like swarms of bees. They approach the inner wall at this central point and seem to "disappear" through the orifice.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: This "sensor swarm" has been coming from a direction that will take them close past Kirk and Spock. Then, as it passes, Spock reaches out quickly, grabs. He turns to Kirk, his hand closed on something.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND SPOCK, (AGAINST "TUBE" WALL)
dialogues.text: Spock opens his hand, retaining a hold on something with his fingers. He brings it up to Kirk's face mask -- it's a tiny SENSOR, its multi-colors flashing as it tries to escape from Spock's fingers. And in this CLOSE VIEW, we SEE that this is a SENSOR very much like the one we've seen earlier embedded in the Ilia-probe's throat hollow. Then Spock releases it and it darts to join the sensor swarm near the opening of the inner wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this closer distance, we SEE that an opening ap- pears in the wall, admits the sensor swarm, then closes immediately.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SHOT
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock exchange a look. Their thruster JETS ignite briefly, moving them in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: closely approaching the inner wall now, timing their movements to coincide with the arrival of another "swarm" -- the wall begins OPENING. The "swarm" through, the wall begins CLOSING -- but Spock and  Kirk slip in before it closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall closing behind them, they are safely inside. But as they stop their forward momentum, their eyes widen with awe and surprise at what they are seeing:

dialogues.speaker: 311A WHAT THEY SEE, (M)
dialogues.text: The long "cave" chamber with its row of huge MEDIATOR BALLS extending into the distance. To one side, the gleaming CRYSTAL MEMORY WALL.

dialogues.speaker: 311B KIRK AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: as Spock makes a quick analysis and estimate of what they are seeing. Then, he takes out his tricorder again, propels himself toward the memory crystals. Kirk follows.

dialogues.speaker: 311C AT MEMORY CRYSTAL
dialogues.text: as Spock adjusts his tricorder through several readings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would appear that the atomic arrays of these crystals store information. A remarkably efficient system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates) And these 'sensor-swarms' collect that data, carry it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; indicates) New crystals: they must contain the most recent data obtained --
