dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spock touches one of these new crystals (it will be shinier, more pulsating than the others): ANOTHER

dialogues.speaker: RAPID
dialogues.text: PROFUSION OF FAINT IMAGES, but this time including a pattern-like image of Klingons, Klingon vessels (the ones destroyed by the Cloud), and obvious Starfleet personnel -- and the Epsilon 9 station. Also, a  pattern of the Security Guard killed by the probe. And Ilia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingons... our Epsilon 9 station ... and Ilia!! They seem to be  more than just images...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) Exact patterns. The energy bolt that hit them wasn't simply a weapon -- it dematerialized them, stored them. But why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he turns and begins moving on, studying the wall, consulting his tricorder.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THEM TO ANOTHER SECTION OF THE WALL
dialogues.text: Spock inspecting this area at which the "newer" crystals are PULSATING and GLOWING, and which appears to be a termination of the Crystal area, continuing on and dis- appearing through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is their ship's data banks, where is the crew? Or is their entire ship automated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I do not believe there is a crew -- or that this is a vessel as such.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as Kirk reacts incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I am almost certain now that all of this is V'ger -- I believe that we are inside a life form, a living machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock turns his spacesuit, turns his tricorder out to- ward the Mediator Balls, takes a reading in that di- rection. Then a glance to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must attempt mindmeld with it, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock touches his spacesuit controls; the THRUSTER JETS move him out toward the Mediator Balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warningly) Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock reaching the Ball, halts his momentum and removes one gauntlet, baring his hand. Stretching the bare hand toward a part of it which looks strangely "alive." The very power generated from this area is clearly affecting Spock's hand. Meanwhile, Kirk has used his THRUSTERS to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, if you're right, its mind may be enormous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Spock pays him no attention, his entire being now focused on the PULSATING GLOW of the "alive" area -- the CAMERA MOVING IN CLOSER TO Spock, as he forces his hand toward that surface, closer, closer.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: watching, almost mesmerized. Torn between wanting to pull Spock away from the wall -- and knowing that Spock must go through with it. For everyone's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: preparing for the ordeal, moving his hand to the "liv- ing area," the invisible force even stronger -- but Spock's strength unwavering, and now he touches the  surface -- and it FLARES WITH STRANGE ENERGY at the touch. And at the same moment Spock' body convulses as if tens of thousands of volts of electricity are charging through him.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK'S FACE
dialogues.text: as he begins to shudder with the shock, the CAMERA CONTINUES INTO EXTREME CLOSE-UP as we SEE Spock's mouth open -- he SCREAMS. CAMERA INTO EXTREME CLOSE SHOT OF SPOCK'S EYES.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SPOCK'S EYES
dialogues.text: MUSIC IN AND UP as we travel through ABSTRACT IMAGES (per Con Pederson discussion). Symbolizing V'ger's incredible and complex store of mechanistic knowledge, these IMAGES suggest patterns of atoms, molecules, galaxies, dimensions of the universe beyond human knowledge or comprehension. It takes only fifteen or twenty seconds, but seems to span aeons, taking us through micro-infinity and macro-infinity.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA BRIDGING BACK OUT THROUGH SPOCK'S EYES AND INTO
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON SPOCK'S FACE as he lies in a sickbay bed. His eyes are open; he is staring straight ahead as if in a catatonic state, completly unaware of his surroundings. Then Doctor Chapel leans INTO SCENE, moving a medical scanner over the brain area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now scanning pons area at spinal nerve fiber connection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 319   ANGLE ON McCOY AND KIRK McCoy at a console, watching readings he is getting from Chapel's scanner. Kirk watches McCoy anxiously. McCOY Indications of some neurological trauma--the power pouring through that mind-meld must have been staggering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Kirk can reply, they HEAR a LAUGH! An abrupt, harsh, bitter laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THEM TO SICKBAY
dialogues.text: as all whirl to the patient area where it is obviously Spock who has just laughed -- but there is no indication of laughter from him now. A startled Chapel has stepped back away from the bed. Spock seems to be attempting to focus, orient himself as Kirk and McCoy hurry to the bedside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Spock reaches out a hand weakly., takes a surprised Kirk's hand in his. McCoy exchanges a surprised glance  with Kirk, as Spock -- clutching Kirk's hand in friend- ship and need -- struggles to summon strength to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This simple feeling... (looks at Kirk) ... is so far beyond V'ger's comprehension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with Kirk and McCoy exchanging another surprised glance (at Spock's emotion), with McCoy gesturing Kirk not to question it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Were you right? Spock? V'ger is a living machine...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) A life form of its own; a conscious, living entity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacting) A living machine...?! McCOY (to Chapel) We're living machines, too: protein mechanisms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk nods at McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it considers the Enterprise a living machine: that's why the probe refers to our ship as an entity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it thinks our ship is alive what does it think we are? McCOY (dryly) An 'infestation' -- bacteria... microbes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Spock turns to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw V'ger's planet: a planet populated by living machines. Unbelievable technology. (pained) V'ger has knowledge that spans this universe. And... in all this order... all this magnificence, V'ger feels no awe...no delight... no beauty... (a beat; exhausted) I should have known...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk waits for Spock to continue, but Spock seems too weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what, Spock? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Spock falls back, exhausted -- and McCoy gently tugs at Kirk, AD-LIBBING, "Let him rest, Jim..." Kirk shrugs McCoy away, addresses Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What should you have known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak) No meaning... No hope... (summoning strength) And, Jim, no answers...! Jim, it's looking for answers itself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What answers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Is this all I am? Is there not more?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then an INTERCOM SIGNAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint signal from Starfleet, sir! Intruder Cloud has been located on their outer monitors for past twenty-seven minutes... dissipating rapidly as it approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately, Sulu's voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet reports forward velocity has slowed to sub-warp speed! We are three minutes from Earth's orbit!-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) I'll be right there... (to Chapel; crisp) I need Spock on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Chapel urns to a MED TECH, AD LIBS an order, "Dalaphaline, twenty cc's..." As the Tech quickly sets the hypo-injector, and hands it to Chapel - and she injects Spock, the hypo emitting a fast, QUIET HISS -- Kirk gazes at Spock just an instant as Spock breathes deeply, the drug clearly strengthening him. Chapel and the Tech help Spock from the bed, as Kirk addresses McCoy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A machine planet...? Sending a machine to Earth looking for its Creator...? McCOY God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk looks at him, then at Spock -- on his feet now -- then at McCoy again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'To find the Creator,' the probe said. Find God...? McCOY Isn't that what we're all trying to do...? (dryly) All us machines...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk stands facing him another moment, then whirls and steps to the monitor, flips some buttons, and peaks into his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, Commander Decker's present location?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... they... are in Engineering, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) I want to make a ship's announcement. But it's to be heard only in Engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice amplified) This is the Captain speaking. It appears that the alien ship... V'ger... is NOT a manned vessel...

dialogues.speaker: ENGINEERING
dialogues.text: SHOWING Scott (at his console) listening to Kirk's words -- and facing Decker and "Ilia" who are just about to leave Engineering. (In b.g. the Engine core GLOWS the appropriate color, and there is a SOFT HUM of IDLE POWER.) Kirk's VOICE continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amplified) It is a living entity...! A machine life form. We are attempting to ascertain its intentions. All personnel will maintain yellow alert status!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe bland as usual, but Kirk's words seem to have strangely elated Decker; he says to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A machine...! Then it had to be programmed. By whom...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (probing) To join, and become One with the Creator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To learn all that is learnable; to deliver all collected data to the Creator on the third planet. That is the programming.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE SCOTT
dialogues.text: just now confronting them, regarding "Ilia" with open disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir, now what about all that? A living entity, the Captain says... entity... A living thing...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker really hasn't heard Scott; he's gazing at "Ilia," attempting to digest what she's just said. But quickly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Scotty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dourly) Your welcome, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Decker and "Ilia" move toward the exit, Scott gaz- ing after them glaringly, watching "Ilia's" every move. Suddenly, almost into the corridor, "Ilia" turns and looks back at the engine room. She addresses Decker, but load enough for Scott to overhear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no logical reason for carbon units to control Enterprise's power systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "Ilia") Lassie, if I were functioning 'logically,' right now I'd be showing you the inside of our scrap metal compactor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk with McCoy and Spock, who although somewhat shaky, is clearly more alert. They are just assuming their stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're now locked into Starfleet's transceivers; Admiral Nogura has received your reports, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk pausing halfway to his chair to study the viewer on which is appearing an IMAGE of V'ger looming omi- nously in orbit over Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The visual is a lunar monitor relay, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they begin to study it, the IMAGE suddenly distorts an is replaced by signal interference -- SIGNAL STATIC LINES

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING ACROSS THE VIEWER SCREEN.
dialogues.text: (Somewhat resembling the kind of high voltage interferenc some-times seen on the television screen.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Heavy interference, sir -- it's coming from here, inside the intruder itself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura hits buttons and immediately from the speakers we  HEAR A SERIES OF CARRIER WAVE BEEPS. Spock looks up from  his console, listens to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzling! The interference appears to be a rather simple carrier wave code signal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On an old style radio frequency, sir...

dialogues.speaker: PAST KIRK TO THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: as the doors snap open and Decker and "Ilia" appear. All eyes go to them as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Decker; interrupting) As I stated, V'ger calls to the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods; turns to Kirk) V'ger is announcing that it has arrived, sir -- that it's ready to deliver the information it was programmed to collect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'To learn all that is learnable.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) It expects a return signal now, ordering it to transmit that  information to the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirling) Sir! V'ger's signals have stopped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if frightened) Decker... The Creator has not  responded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk hears this, turning inquiringly toward her, but Uhura interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picking up Starfleet again; a lunar monitor relay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as, indeed, the interference is fading and a new Main  Viewer IMAGE is appearing -- it shows V'GER IN EARTH  ORBIT with a strange looking OBJECT moving away from  V'ger. It is an ominous looking, HUGE SWIRLING GREEN MASS -- it resembles the same green plasma-energy bolts that destroyed the Klingons and Epsilon 9 -- and very  nearly the Enterprise. It is not a bolt now -- the mass  is much larger and appears much more deadly. A second  object has now formed and moves off, a third one begins  to appear. (Meanwhile, the first and second PLASMA- ENERGY OBJECTS are moving off into the distance in  different direction.) McCOY My God! They're the same kind of things that destroyed the Klingons, Epsilon Nine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting; from science console) These read as identical composition... (turns to Kirk) ... however, Captain, they measure several hundred times more powerful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High mag, Mr. Sulu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu adjusts the viewer through several IMAGE MAGNI- FICATIONS until we SEE the huge OMINOUS GREEN DEVICES more clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third one is moving off too -- a fourth one is forming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Urgent signal from Starfleet, Captain! (turns, shaken) All Earth defense systems have gone dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk reacts hard at this. Uhura gets another message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sir, Starfleet computes their trajectories as moving toward equidistant positions over Earth.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK AND SPOCK
dialogues.text: exchanging significant glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From four equidistant positions, Captain, a detonation would blanket the entire surface of the planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I plot them as reaching equidistant positions in... twenty-nine minutes, sir... mark!

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK TO DECKER AND "ILIA"
dialogues.text: as Kirk vaults from his chair, strides to a handrail to confront the "Ilia"-probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carbon-units infection will now be removed from the Creator's planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creator has not answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carbon-units are not responsible for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You infest and control Enterprise. V'ger believes carbon-units interfere with the Creator in the same manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk) Then V'ger believes the Creator to be a machine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) It seems we all imagine God in our own image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three of the four OMINOUS SWIRLING GREEN OBJECTS have all moved away from V'ger now, in different directions, growing smaller in the distance. The fourth object is holding position nearby, seeming to grow in size and intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he throws a look toward Spock who is now in deep meditation. Kirk turns and takes "Ilia's" shoulders and carefully turns her to face him. McCOY '... similar life forms...?' Jim, V'ger's saying the Creator is a machine...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly amused) Of course: we all create God in our own image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk peers at Decker a moment, ingesting this thought.  Then he addresses "Ilia" again, this time with emotion:  after all, he is pleading for the survival of the  entire planet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger! If we are lesser beings, we are still, like you, living. And because we are alive, we -- like you -- wish to survive. You must not destroy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk pauses abruptly: "Ilia" is regarding him blandly, stonily -- not the slightest reaction or response; clearly Kirk's plea is being ignored. Kirk draws in his breath to continue, realizes the futility, turns helplessly to Spock.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK TO SPOCK
dialogues.text: who has been listening intently, with near fascination -- an idea forming in his mind. Quickly, he steps down to Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, terse) Captain... (reaches Kirk) Treat V'ger as you would... a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: startled at this, not sure he's heard correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Child...!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Captain, a child: evolving into adulthood -- learning, searching -- instinctively needing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intrigued) Needing what...? McCOY Spock, this 'child' is about to eliminate all life on Earth; how do we teach it that that's 'wrong'? With a spanking...!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock peers at McCoy almost sadly, then replies to Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't know what it needs, Comm          ander... (to Kirk) It does not know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk says nothing, looks at Spock who is awaiting a reaction; then Kirk glances at "Ilia" -- his brain is racing, struggling to reach a decision. And then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly to "Ilia") The carbon--units-know-why-the Creator-has-not-responded. McCOY (shocked) Jim...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "Ilia," urgingly) Ilia... we can help V'ger find what it needs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" studies Decker just a bland beat, then turns to Kirk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk, hard) Disclose the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool, calm) Not until V'ger withdraws the devices orbiting the third planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk studies her a moment, then decides to press his bet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "Ilia," almost pleasant) No. (then to crew commandingly) Secure all stations. Clear the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment where all are startled at this order -- but no time for questions as just then the ship is ROCKED BY A FURIOUS POWERFUL ERUPTION NEARBY within V'ger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amplified) Bridge to all decks,secure your stations. McCOY Your child is having a tantrum, Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear the bridge, Captain...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the order, Mr. Sulu: Clear the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then another ERUPTION -- the ship is ROCKED AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rocked about by the furious powerfields -- with frightening displays of ray energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as all react to the powerful blasts, holding on to  railings, etc, at the same time attempting to secure their stations for the evacuation. The DAMAGE REPAIR TECHNICIAN leaves his station, crossing to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving bridge; to Captain) Severe stress on engine pylons, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kirk; flat) V'ger requires the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk merely looks at her, then to the evacuating crew:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge secure all stations!  Move out! McCOY Jim, what the hell kind of strategy is this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Decker has crossed to Chekov's now abandoned console, checks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All ship's functions going to automatic, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: KIRK
dialogues.text: turning to confront "Ilia":

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If V'ger destroys the Enterprise, the information V'ger requires will also be destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: 339A INCLUDING VIEWER
dialogues.text: as LIGHT SHOW outside perceptically recedes, and simul- taneously the ROCKING CEASES. At the same time, "Ilia" is saying:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is illogical to withhold required information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk does not reply to this, turns away to observe the withdrawing crew. Most are out; only Spock, Decker and McCoy remain behind -- with McCoy on his  way. The bridge lighting dims, and now Kirk looks at Spock, who nods approvingly; clearly Spock is the only person who seems to comprehend what Kirk is doing, and why. As Kirk now moves toward the exit, and the lights  are dimmed even further:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost polite) Kirk-unit, why do you not disclose information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because V'ger is going to destroy all the carbon units on the third planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have repressed the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The information will not be disclosed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, gesturing the others ahead of him, Kirk starts toward the bridge elevator. "Ilia" calls after him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a plea) V'ger needs the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker and McCoy about to enter, Spock and Kirk just behind -- all stopping abruptly now at "Ilia's" state- ment. The very tone of her voice is enough for them to realize they have made a very telling point. Kirk follows fast:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then V'ger must withdraw its orbiting devices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger will comply if the carbon units disclose the information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 341   ANGLE ON McCOY wryly reacting to this: McCOY It learns fast, doesn't it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 342   ACROSS McCOY TO KIRK AND SPOCK as Kirk looks at Spock, Kirk's whole expression convey- ing the obvious question: "What the hell do we do now?" But Spock is ready with an answer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the vessel -- V'ger -- obviously operates from a central brain complex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock allows the sentence to hang, as he and Kirk eye each other significantly, the CAMERA SWINGING OVER TO KIRK so we can perceive that to Kirk this idea has an even greater significance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spock) The orbiting devices would be controlled from the point, then...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk nods grimly, faces "Ilia" again; this time  he's playing for all the stakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carbon units' information cannot be disclosed to V'ger's probe... only to V'ger directly.

dialogues.speaker: REACTIONS
dialogues.text: all wait with hushed expectancy, all eyes on "Ilia" who seems momentarily in some internal communication. She turns away from Kirk and steps forward looking at the Main Viewer. McCOY (indicating viewer) Jim...!

dialogues.speaker: PAST THEM TO VIEWER
dialogues.text: the image of the chamber in which the Enterprise is imprisoned. But now, toward the chamber-end, where further passage had previously been barred by the lace- work energy barriers -- an OPENING APPEARS. And at the same time there is a GENTLE LURCHING EFFECT, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward motion, Captain...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tractor beam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" steps down from the platform and into the well where she is closer to the viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, what's the next move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is, Mr. Decker, is there a next move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving through the chamber, pulled by the invisible tractor beam, toward the OPENING -- toward the next chamber which, from this POV seems even larger, more forbidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the four officers step down onto the bridge, Spock hurrying to his science station, Kirk to the center seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resume duty stations, Mr. Decker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kirk attends to his console, Deck is at an intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom, voice amplified) All personnel resume stations...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the same time the lights are brightening -- and members of the bridge crew begin returning. All this time there is an ever increasing sense of movement. Kirk glances at Decker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Decker, it seems my bluff is being called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid our hand is pretty weak, Captain. (slight smile) But it's the only game in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk reacts, pleased, a split beat at Decker's "our" hand, and goes on: Kirk throws him a look of appreciation, then, abruptly his manner changes as he addresses Chekov:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, when do those devices activate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach final position in... Twenty-seven minutes -- mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; then into intercom) Engineering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at his console, a female engineering technician (CHIEF ROSS) nearby, the usual engine room ambience in the b.g., as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: as Kirk hesitates, glances around at the crew -- now all having resumed their stations -- and then grimly looks at "Ilia" who still remains at the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom, eyes on "Ilia") Mr. Scott, be prepared to execute Starfleet order two zero zero five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing this, Spock whirls around -- peers incredulously at Kirk. He appears for a moment to be incensed at Kirk's words. Then he realizes and understands Kirk's position and turns, sadly resigned, back to his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Scott, too, hears this, but his reaction is of grim acceptance. Not so Chief Ross; she is horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a glance at Ross, into intercom) When, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somberly, into intercom) Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Scott hits buttons on his console, now moves to step from his station, nearly collides with Ross, who clearly is bravely struggling to maintain her poise and dignity:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why has the Captain ordered self- destruct, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; gently) I would say, lass, because he thinks -- he hopes -- that when we go up... we'll take V'ger with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with grim satisfaction) When that much matter and anti- matter are brought together? Oh, yes; we will, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship passing now through a chamber that is vastly more active than anything we have previously seen. Directly ahead appears to be an area that dispatches powerfields; a tremendous volume of them seem to ema- nate and converge there. The medium from which the ship moves appears almost solid, to the point where it seems incredible that the ship can be pulled through it at all. The entire chamber pulses with machine- like, alien life. This should even be evidenced in the booming POWERFIELD LIGHTENING BOLTS as they course in ever more frighteningly close proximity to the ship as:

dialogues.speaker: 350A INT BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The crew all watching the awesome spectacle of V'ger's interior (on the viewer) as the Enterprise is being pulled toward the brain complex. All are somewhat sub- dued, for all realize how their journey will end -- but at the same time they also realize there is no other way. The CAMERA PANS, catching facial reactions -- as, in the b.g., we HEAR a constant flow of AD-LIBBED crew comments:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five minutes to device activation, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALT. (Twenty-two) ALT. (Eighteen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet has been apprised of  our situation, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tractor beam remains constant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are seventeen kilometers inside the vessel...

dialogues.speaker: SPOCK
dialogues.text: His back to the viewer, the angle does not reveal his facial features, but we can discern him struggling to contain his feelings. 352   WIDER ANGLE (INCLUDE KIRK, McCOY, AND DECKER) Kirk's back to Spock as he watches the viewer, Kirk now turning toward Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock... Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock does not respond, then Kirk reacts with momentary annoyance, then realizes Spock is totally distracted. Kirk peers at him a moment, then suddenly rises and steps up to: 353   SPOCK'S STATION - KIRK AND SPOCK (McCOY IN B.G.) as Kirk arrives, with Spock still facing away from him, clearly distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts) Mr. Spock -- I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock moves to face him, turning fully INTO the CAMERA so we can see now, just under Spock's eye: A tear! Welling fom the eye, rolling down his cheek. Kirk is speechless a moment, glances at McCoy who has also witnessed this phenomenon, and started toward Spock; but Kirk gestures McCoy to stay back, as he addresses Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, feeling) Not for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Captain, not for us... for V'ger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock pauses as Kirk peers incredulously at him, then continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I weep for V'ger, as I would for a brother -- far more knowledgeable than I -- and yet one step behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 354   ANGLE ON McCOY AND DECKER Listening, McCoy's face reflecting concern; Decker's face compassion and understanding, with Decker step- ping closer to Spock, as Spock continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I was -- when I came aboard... so is V'ger now: empty, incomplete. Searching. Logic and knowledge are not enough. McCOY (with empathy) Spock, are you saying that you found, what you needed -- but V'ger hasn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has not, Doctor -- and now, because of what we are planning... will not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost hard) There is no alternative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently pressing) Mr. Spock, what would V'ger need to fulfill itself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger has begun to understand the true limits of our universe, thereby realizing the existence of other dimensions. To fulfill itself it must evolve to a higher dimension; V'ger believes this can be achieved only by joining with the Creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of us, at some time in our life, turns to someone, a father, a brother, a God and asks 'Why am I here?' 'What was I meant to be?' V'ger hopes to touch its Creator to find its answers.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS KIRK TO DECKER
dialogues.text: as Decker reacts with sudden, almost evangelical en- lightenment, as Kirk Says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) 'Is this all that I am? Is there nothing more?

dialogues.speaker: ON DIFALCO
dialogues.text: reacting to the (O.S.) viewer, AD-LIBBING a terse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where another opening is suddenly visible -- another chamber. But the violent and color energy effects of the previous chambers are no longer evident. Instead, the entire chamber appears beautifully symmetrical, with a strange, subdued glow, which increases as we move closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flat) Captain, I believe that is our destination.

dialogues.speaker: COMPLEX
dialogues.text: This enormous chamber resembles a hemisphere, laced throughout with dazzling energy patterns, not at all ominous, but quite lovely in effect. As the Enterprise continues forward motion, now ahead you will to SEE a small "island." Floating in the exact center of the hemisphere, the "island" seems alive with PULSING LIGHT, with more of the lovely and delicate ENERGY FORMS and COLORS. On the "island," vague at this distance, ap pears to be a "solid" matter form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "island" looming larger in the distance. And the Enterprise (as evidenced from the viewer) perceptibly slowing. Kirk just resuming his command chair, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward motion slowing, Captain...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk says nothing a moment, studies the viewer -- and then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Engineering... Status, Mr. Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somber) We're ready, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Thank you, Scotty. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 358   ACROSS KIRK TO McCOY as Kirk turns from the intercom and glances at McCoy. Between them a total look of understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Enterprise approaching the edge of the "island" -- slowing, but still quite clearly being pulled by the tractor beam. The "solid matter" in the "island" cen- ter still obscured by the STRANGE LIGHT GLOW emanating from that area. The Enterprise is now nearly at the "island" edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as all watching "island" loom closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tractor beam strength lessening, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Mr. Scott... on my next signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast) Captain, the orbital device will     (ALT.) not be triggered for twenty-two      (nineteen...) minutes...                           (fifteen...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point... (Your)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eying "Ilia"; carefully) The point is, Captain, twenty-two    (ALT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: should minutes. We could have that much      loop "19" & more time...                                 "15")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk glances at the Viewer, the oncoming "island," then at Spock:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head, no)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ALT: "19",)    (Mr. Spock), if we do not provide (     "15  )    V'ger with certain information, we won't have twenty-two seconds; the plan must be implemented upon arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we can't be sure that our... move... will actually save Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker's last word is interrupted by an almost gentle BUMP -- and on the Viewer all perceptible motion has stopped. At the same time:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forward motion stopped, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tractor beam is released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's sauce leading edge holding position at the "island" edge as though docked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching the (O.S.) Viewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating viewer) V'ger...

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDING THE VIEWER KIRK AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: all very silent a moment, gazing at the sight. Now Kirk glances at the people around him: on his command their lives are about to end. Nothing is said; no time for it, no inclination to articulate the obvious. No need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom: with finality) Mr. Scott...

dialogues.speaker: CHEKOV
dialogues.text: reacting to a console reading with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain... I read an oxygen and gravity envelope forming outside the Enterprise...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I have located the source of V'ger's radio signal: (it's) directly ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That transmitter is a vital link between V'ger and the Creator. (its)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ALT. "18",)   We have twenty-one minutes. Captain, (.... "14" )   we can still save V'ger... and ourselves.  All this has caused Kirk to vacillate, but he still believes his course of action is the proper one, as:-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carbon units will now provide  V'ger the required information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Ilia" is moving toward the elevator, turning to face the others as she says this. Kirk remains frozen, his hand on the intercom button. He glances at McCoy, as though seeking advice. McCoy peers at him blandly, levelly; Kirk must follow his own instinct.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING KIRK
dialogues.text: gazing at "Ilia," then at Spock, his brain racing, con- sidering all the possibilities, options. He glances at the anxious faces awaiting his decision: a possible twenty-two more minutes of life -- or instant death. Another beat as he decides. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Mr. Scott... we're holding off; there may be a chance... (rises, gestures Spock and McCoy) Spock, Bones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for elevator.

dialogues.speaker: PAST DECKER TO KIRK
dialogues.text: as Kirk strides toward the elevator, joining McCoy and Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Decker... I will contact you every five minutes. Otherwise... inform Mr. Scott immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after him) Captain... I'd like to go along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk studies Decker a beat -- there is something com- pelling about Decker's manner -- a certain sense of absolute necessity. Kirk seems about to deny the re- quest, then turns to Sulu:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sulu, you have the conn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kirk leaves; Decker, his face reflecting a strange, almost eager gratification, hurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V'ger plans to literally meld to reduce both itself and the Creator to patterns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and then to reassemble itself combined with the Creator. The most certain way of obtaining all the Creator's answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden STORM OF LIGHT AND STRANGE SOUND. In the midst of it, Kirk finds a SHAFT OF LIGHT very much centering on him. He sees "Ilia" watching him with none of their "former navigator" in her expression now. Kirk hesitates, gathering his thoughts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "Ilia") Our data is being prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will answer and present proof of our answer when it is ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk's words lead to a suggestion of FRUSTRATION in the STORM OF LIGHT AND SOUND around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) V'ger, we will bring the Creator to you! Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he moves to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need only a few more minutes. Believe me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decker has reached out to touch her -- the probe spins at his touch -- the move knocks Decker from his feet, tumbling, a hard fall. Then the robe looks at him lying there -- just the slightest softening of her features now.

dialogues.speaker: EMPHASIZING DECKER
dialogues.text: slowly turning to face the probe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilia, believe me... the Creator will appear!

dialogues.speaker: EMPHASIZING "ILIA"
dialogues.text: as she meets Decker's look, her expression softening still more. The STORM OF LIGHT and SOUND begins to subside a bit. She moves to him and he gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise to Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura with Sulu and Chekov there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem, Captain: the response signal is not in our records. Voyager Six was sent out by Earth's "United States Subdivision.' The code was probably...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Uhura continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... kept secret to keep Voyager's data from rival subdivisions. McCOY That's preposterous! They wouldn't have kept scientific data from one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are now checking with Starfleet Archives, Captain. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER AND "ILIA"
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock and McCoy are standing some distance from them (out of hearing). The probe is clearly moving into still closer touch with Lt. Ilia's memory patterns as Decker takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when V'ger melds? What will happen to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will... take me from you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 373   KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY McCoy is looking at Kirk with an incredulous expression on his face. McCOY And when it realizes what the Creator is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way to know. V'ger expected it to be a machine -- some single entity. (indicates entire site) All of us here may be reduced into patterns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems to be what it has planned -- to have the Creator physically present here. McCOY (small smile) The God it captures is going to be a hell of a disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER AND "ILIA"
dialogues.text: at the side of Voyager Six, Decker in the midst of twisting a wing-nut which releases a hatch which swings open. Decker peers inside while "Ilia" waits. 375   KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY Decker and "Ilia" at the old capsule in b.g. as Kirk looks that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE Decker look up at Kirk's call, then ignore him and go back to inspecting inside the access hatch. At this moment, from Kirk's communicator, a SIGNAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; into communicator) Kirk here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now have the response code, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by. Transmit it on my orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them exchange looks -- Kirk, Spock and McCoy exchanging a silent moment of friendship and resignation. Then Kirk lifts his communicator again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Enterprise... transmit.

dialogues.speaker: DECKER AND "ILIA"
dialogues.text: catching Decker in the midst of pressing a control on his tricorder. Both he and "Ilia" are watching Kirk and the others closely. Now Decker looks down at the tricorder's face. He nods:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recording...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 377   KIRK, SPOCK AND McCOY still waiting. They continue to wait. McCoy shifts uncomfortably, throws Kirk a puzzled glance. Kirk finally lifts his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enterprise, are you transmitting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative, Captain. For some time now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirm code and transmitting frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both signal and frequency confirmed, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Captain Kirk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the others turn to Decker and "Ilia."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The fault is here, sir, not in the transmission. (indicating into hatch) The antenna leads have been disconnected. V'ger never intended to accept a transmitted signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Capture God! In order to retrieve V'ger's data, the Creator has to physically come here!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And plug the signal directly into the circuitry at this... (indicates into access) ... point here, Captain. It should pick up even a tricorder playback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting communicator) Enterprise, I want that signal again. Transmit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Kirk touches a control on his tricorder exactly as Decker did earlier. Then he looks up, reacts as he sees Decker holding his own tricorder up -- and a smile playing on Decker's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Kirk suddenly pivots, races toward Decker -- but he passes too close to the "Ilia"-probe. It sends him spinning back, tumbling to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: AT KIRK
dialogues.text: as KIRK starts up to scramble to his feet but Spock has stepped in, putting a hand on Kirk's shoulder and re straining him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim... he wants it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the Enterprise, it's what you wanted. This is what I want. (smiles) But, Jim... (now very seriously) ... I'm the right choice for this mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Decker shoves the tricorder into the access hatch.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSCENDING, (S)
dialogues.text: For just an instant nothing happens -- and then a  BLINDING SHAFT OF LIGHT STRIKES Decker. The color becomes BRIGHTER AND BRIGHTER, begins spiraling through the room. "Ilia" stes toward Decker, is caught in the LIGHT, and instantly VANISHES in a BRILLIANT WHITE GLOW. We SEE Decker seeming to grow larger -- as if his molecular pattern is expanding. A SPECTACULAR SERIES OF VISUALS., THE SPIRALING LIGHT enveloping the entire area. All this emanating from Decker's body, becoming LARGER -- also BRIGHTER AND BRIGHTER until now it is almost transparent. And the SPIRALING now expanding in all directions, and the room itself starting to dissolve, vanishing into nothingness -- and all commencing to slip into the new dimension. Kirk, Spock and McCoy stand transfixed another instant. Around them, V'ger seems to be TRANSFORMING INTO BRIL- LIANT, LOVELY PATTERNS. They all turn and race into the complex in the direction of their vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It too seems to be flowering into loveliness, brilliant, graceful patterns as they seem to slip through to another dimension, vanishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "FLOWERING" EFFECT now spreading outward, V'ger's massive shape becoming a spiraling pattern of twisting, graceful shapes and brilliant colors -- a transcendence into another dimension. And then all of that is left is a shimmering, jewel-like point of light -- and then it too fades -- and reveals there in the blue-black of space, the U.S.S. Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which shows now only space and its familiar star patterns. All gaze at the viewer, awed at what they've seen and undergone. They exchange looks silently, no one wanting to be the first to try to comment on some- thing which is beyond mere words. We HEAR an ELEVATOR DOOR, Scott and Chapel ENTER the bridge and stand  silently watching. McCOY Well, it certainly has been... interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, we were its answer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Yes, Captain. It needed our mortality, the fear of it, our struggle against it, our fears, our dreams...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and the 'foolish' emotions which drive us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Kirk; then) I prefer your poet Dante's phrase -- 'the divine restlessness of the human spirit.' McCOY Spock... you're quoting poetry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's cold look at McCoy is interrupted by:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet signal, Captain! Return to orbital dockyard for inspection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore that signal. (to Scott) Shall we give the Enterprise a proper shakedown, Mr. Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly beaming) I'd say it's time for that, I would, sir. (toward Spock) We can have you back on Vulcan in four days, Mr. Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly) I have no business on Vulcan, Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Spock exchange a look -- then Kirk turns to the helm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead Warp One, Mr. Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking center seat; indicates generally) Out there.  Thataway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods gravely) A most logical choice, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the trace of a smile comes over Spock's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planet Earth in the distance, and receding in size as the starship heads out the other direction. FADE OUT.
